Mariela is going to use her loan to buy more fabrics and decorative objects for her clothes. She likes to add pompoms to the end of hats and other accessories to make fun clothing that children will enjoy wearing. Mariela's business has grown since she first started selling children's clothes and now she sells her clothes in another woman's store, but she dreams of owning her own store someday.

Mariela is a mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She hopes her children will continue to be successful in school and will go on to have successful careers after they finish school.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics and embroidery materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a married woman who lives in Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store and a food vending business. Her common-law husband Adolfo, who is 46 years old, works as a chainsaw operator to earn his living.  They have five children who are between 1 and 17 years old. 

Juanita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Juanita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 to buy more products to resell so that she can continue to save up for future family needs and the education of her children. Juanita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is 64 years old and married with nine children.

Basilisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Basilisa has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for eight years and earns an income from it.

Basilisa aspires to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela N. is from the village of Tonggo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Angela is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Angela owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a motorcycle transport service. Angela is just starting this business.

In 2007, Angela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Angela has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Angela is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Angela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories for her transportation service

loans.name: Los Lideres Group

texts.es:
Jovita 36 años D. edad, madre soltera. Socia D. la alcancia comunal "Los Lideres".
Jovita tiene 3 hijos, Lizbeth D. 14, Masiel D. 10, y Robinson D. 4 años.
Jovita tiene como negocio la venta D. ropa y calzado repontenciada (segunda mano), y venD. estos productos en la feria D. la avenida Huancavelica todos los dias domingos; los otros dias reparte a pedido por la zona donD. vive. Estos articulos Jovita tiene que darle mantenimiento como por ejemplo: luztrar los calzados, lavar y planchar las prendas.
El prestamo adquirido es para comprar otras mercaderias para poder incrementar sus ventas.
(En la fotografia Jovita esta vestida con pantalon color gris y chompa color celeste, es la cuarta D. la izquierda)
texts.en:
Jovita is 36 years old and a single member. She is a member of the Los Lideres (Leaders) community bank. Jovita has three children: Lizbeth-14, Masiel-10, and Robinson-4. Jovita has a business selling second-hand clothing and shoes at the Huancavelica Avenue market every Sunday. On the other days, she sells by delivering around the area where she lives. Jovita has to do some work on her products, for example, shining shoes and washing and ironing clothing.

This loan is to buy merchandise to increase her sales.

In the photograph, Jovita is wearing gray pants and a light blue sweater. She is the fourth one from the left.

loans.use: buy merchandise (clothing and shoes)

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn O. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 44 years old and single. 

To make a living, Arlyn provides Internet services in the local community. Arlyn has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Arlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Arlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for his business. Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a printer to improve his Internet services. 

This will be the fifth loan taken out by Arlyn from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a printer to improve his Internet services.

loans.name: Dezi

texts.en:
Dezi lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 5 children, three of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren).

Dezi has a food stall business. She has been in this business for 5 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Dezi sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Dezi has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, oranges, bunches of bananas and a sack of cassava.

She also generates additional income through rental rooms.The main business challenges for Dezi include rainy weather which hinders her customers to reach out to her and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to farmers directly and build more rental rooms.

Dezi lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, oranges, cassava and bunches of bananas

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 48 años, reside en la localidad de Palomar (selva central peruana), ahí formó su familia junto a Eugenia, su esposa desde hace 8 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Carlos y Carla a la que educan y crían en su casa propia. Cuando era niño, aprendió todo lo que debía saber de la tierra y como producirla, es entonces que poco a poco a medida que pasaba el tiempo, él se fue encargando de las tierras de sus padres. Ahora tiene extensas tierras de cultivo, en las cuales cosecha café, plátano y palta, para luego venderlos en el mercado de la ciudad de La Merced. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es la actividad que le brinda el sustento familiar. Lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus productos de la plaga de insectos. Pero el trabajo constante y la dedicación que le brinda a sus cultivos hacen que en cada cosecha de café, obtenga buenas ganancias, ya que los acopiadores de la zona lo conocen por ser una persona trabajadora y cumplida. Además lo motiva el noble sacrificio de su esposa, quien trabaja como promotora de educación en la capital del país, donde enseña a niños menores a leer y escribir. Constantemente viaja para poder ver a su familia sin descuidar su trabajo; es por ello que desea con muchas ganas, comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda transportar sus productos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de café” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para lograr sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Carlos de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus sembríos de café, que dentro de algunos meses cosechará.
texts.en:
Carlos, 48 years old, resides in the locality of Palomar (in the central Peruvian rain forest). Here he formed his family with Eugenia, his wife of 8 years. They have 2 children: Carlos and Carla, who they are educating and raising in their own house. 

When he was young, Carlos learned all he needed to know about the earth and how to make it produce. It was then that little by little, with the passage of time, he was placed in charge of his parents' lands. Now, he has extensive cultivated fields, in which he grows coffee, plantains, and avocados, which he sells in the city markets at La Merced.

What he likes most about his work is cultivating the earth, because it is the activity that offers sustenance for his family. He has been at this for 12 years and the most difficult part is protecting his crops from plagues of insects. But constant work and dedication has resulted in each coffee harvest resulting in good earnings, and the local buyers know him as a hard-working and reliable person.

Also, Carlos doesn't forget the noble sacrifice of his wife who works as an educational promoter in the capital of the country, where she teaches children to read and write. Constantly, she travels to see her family without neglecting her work; that's motivates him with much determination, to buy a car for transporting his products.

Carlos belongs to the “Aroma de Cafe” (Aroma of Coffee) communal bank and this is his 4th loan through MFP, whose collaboration he awaits in order to achieve his objectives. And he promises once again to make his payments, as with his previous loans. Carlos  is pleased to be a part of his communal bank, because all the members are responsible people with much solidarity. Carlos will invest the money in buying various sacks of organic manure to spread around his coffee trees, which within months will be harvested.

loans.use: buy various sacks of organic manure to spread around his coffee trees.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Grace has operated a food shop selling chicken and pork barbecue for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for barbecuing. Grace is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for barbecuing

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en: Leonarda lives in El Paraiso, Honduras, where she makes a living selling clothing and cosmetics. She has run this small business for the past 15 years out of a stall in the central market. Leonarda is requesting a loan of HNL 15,000  to purchase shirts, pants, skirts, dresses, blouses, shoes, sandals, cosmetics, and umbrellas.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, cosmetics and umbrellas

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude lives in Uganda. She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (3 orphans). Gertrude lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Gertrude has a business of tailoring. She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. She sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Gertrude has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of clothes. She also generates additional income through a bridal jewelry shop and night parking garage. The main business challenges for Gertrude include seasonality and   thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal shop in Kampala city.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing materials

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en:
Emerenciana is a 65-year-old widow with nine children.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Emerenciana has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 30 years.  Emerenciana has requested a loan amount of PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell in her stall.

Emerenciana would like to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marilyn's priority is preparing for her children's education so they can become professionals someday. She is 46 years old and married to a farmer. They are blessed with three school-age children.

Marilyn says that education, rather than wealth, is the best treasure they can give to their children. She strives with her husband so they can send their children to school to finish their studies. In fact, Marilyn also does farm activities just to lessen the farming labor costs.

Marilyn is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides needed in rice farming. She hopes to succeed in this type of business and be able to make her priority become reality.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides needed in rice farming.

loans.name: Kisiwani Group

texts.en:
Hawa, who is in her late 30s, is married with two children who go to school.  She has had a food vendor business for eight years now. She works from 6 am to 4 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to pay school fees and increase her food stock and has paid all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to increase her food stock and pay school fees. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with his loan group "Kisiwani", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase her food stock and pay school fees.

loans.name: Jenisa Group

texts.en:
Jenisa is 32 years old and lives in Molave. She is married with 3 children. 
Jenisa has a business that sells dried fish. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000  to purchase more dried fish to sell.
Jenisa has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. Jenisa is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Lhe

texts.en:
Lhe is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Lhe has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Lhe is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lhe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Raghda

texts.en:
Raghda is a 44-year-old housewife, who is raising a daughter and a son with her husband who is a worker at one of the glass factories in Jordan. 

Since she was 18 years old, Raghda has made embroidered stuff for fun, and now, using her long experience in embroidery she started a small business at home making embroidered pillows, wall hangings, and other items to sell.

Now Raghda wants to widen her business and add more variety to what she makes, such as making embroidered table covers, picture frames, and others. In order to do that she applied for a loan to buy more materiA. that she needs to achieve her goA..

loans.use: to buy more embroidery material to make new items.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past seven years, Charles has been working hard to manage his bookstore, which sells all types of textbooks and stationary products. 

To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more textbooks and will help Charles to generate greater profits as well as buy a printer for the store. Charles hopes that in the future he will be able to finish building his house and start another stationary store. 

Charles is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charles who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more textbooks to sell in his bookstore.

loans.name: Herney De Jesus

texts.es:
Herney desde hace 5 años monto su negocio de legumbrería donde ofrece unas excelentes frutas y verduras a sus clientes, con este negocios el consigue el sustento diario para su familia que está conformada por su compañera y sus dos hijos.

El se sueña mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, además de poder ofrecerles un futuro mejor a su hijos, para esto el quiere ampliar su negocio y adecuarlo para así sus clientes se sientan mas cómodos y mayor variedad.
texts.en:
5 years ago Herney established his greengrocer business which offers excellent fruit and vegetables to his customers. Through this business he is able to provide for his family, which consists of his partner and two children.  

Herney dreams of improving the quality of life for his family and wants to offer a better future for his children. He wants to expand and adapt his business so that his customers feel more comfortable and have more variety to choose from.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, vegetables and provisions to expand his business, as well as shelves, chairs and tables.

loans.name: Angelita De La Cruz

texts.es: Angelita, de oficio costurera pero también se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general , ella tiene 46 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos, los cuales dos de ellos están en la universidad y el menor de sus hijos esta cursando el primer año de su secundaria. Doña Angelita tiene mas de 20 años de ser costurera su madre le enseño este oficio y ella lo aprendió de ello ha sobrevivido, ofreciendo la ropa que cose de manera ambulante y en su casa , donde abre las puertas de su casa  saca su maquina de coser, las tijeras, el hilo y el ruido resonante de su maquina cuando comienza a coser forman parte de su tareas diarias. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar tela, encajes, lentejuelas, hilos, elásticos, cintas de colores ya que necesita materia prima para trabajar y cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen y el crédito le vendría ayudar a suplir parte de sus necesidades. A ella le gustaría alquilar un local céntrico donde pueda poner una tienda de ropa y mercadería en general donde pueda vender parte de las piezas de ropas que ella misma cose y otras tipos de mercadería de uso general en su vecindario.
texts.en:
Angelita is a seamstress by profession but also sells general merchandise.  She is 46 years old, married, and has three children.  Two of her children are at university and her youngest is in his first year of high school.  Angelita has been a dressmaker for more than 20 years.  Her mother taught her this trade and it has enabled her to survive.  She offers the clothes that she sews both as an itinerant vendor and from her home.  She opens the doors of her house, gets out her sewing machine, scissors and thread.  This and the resonant noise of her machine form part of her daily work.  

Angelita is requesting a loan to buy fabric, lace, sequins, threads, elastic and colored ribbons as she needs raw materials so that she can work and fill the orders that she has.  The loan will help her to meet some of her needs.  Angelita would like to hire premises in a central area where she can set up a store to sell clothes and general merchandise.  She would sell some of the clothes that she sews herself and other general merchandise.

loans.use: to buy fabric, lace, sequins, thread, elastic and colored ribbons

loans.name: Jose Ramiro

texts.es:
El sr. Jose Ramiro, cuenta con uan barraca, en  la ciudad de Cochabamba, es divorciado, vive con su hijo, el tiene multiples actividades, administra una barraca para comercializar madera cortada, como tambien trae productos medicos, como bendas, fajas, articulos ortopedicos, desde la frontera para comercializarlos.

El sr. Jose Ramiro conoce muy bien el mercado de la madera, comercializa tablas para construccion como tambien madera para carpnteria. 
Se le ha presentado una oportunidad de compra de madera a un precio oportuno y no debe perder esta oferta, por lo que recurrio a solicitar el credito, que le favorecera mucho, le ayudara a hacer crecer su negocio y sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Jose Ramiro has a storage shed in Cochabamba.  He’s divorced, lives with his son, and manages a storage shed for lumber distribution.  He also imports and sells medical products such as bandages, bands, and orthopedic articles.

Jose Ramiro knows the lumber market very well and sells lumber for construction and carpentry.

He has the opportunity to buy lumber at a good price and he does not want to lose this deal, so he’s seen fit to ask for this loan that will benefit him greatly.  It will help him grow his business and move his son ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy lumber for resale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Betty. She is married and has four children aged 16, 14, 11 and 5 years old. 
In 2002, Betty established a clothing business. She began her business because she was told it would be profitable and because she needed to help her husband to support their family. Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, Betty earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan of 4,500,000 SLL. Betty has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy waxed cotton, lace material and knickers for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. In the future, Betty plans to transform her stall into a shop and engage in international business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy waxed cotton, lace material and knickers for her business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is married and works hard to support her family. She has operated a fishing business in the Philippines for 2 years. She also earns additional income from a variety store, gasoline retail sales and an oyster farm.

Zenaida has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy paint, bamboo and other equipment to repair her fishing boat. Zenaida would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy paint, bamboo and other equipment to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Jiendeleze - Ngima Group

texts.en:
Sebastian is a 69-year-old married man with three children. He is good in growing coffee, maize, and beans for over 16 years. He faces farming problems - basically lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

He works to find funds to buy fertilizers and insecticides. He wishes to expand his scale of production from 5 to 12 acres in the next 5 years.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Rodgers

texts.en:
Rodgers is 48 years old, married, and has six children. He runs a retail shop in his local trading center and has been in this business for 10 years earning a monthly income of 18,000 KES.

Rodgers is applying for his second loan with KADET for 40,000 KES, which he will  use to purchase stock of rice, maize, flour, sugar, and cooking oil for his shop. The anticipated profits will be put back into the business. His dreams are to prosper in business and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice, maize, flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Deborah wants to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en: Shaban A. is 46 years old. He has had his own auto-repair business since 1993. Before that he worked as a auto mechanic in another garage but decided to set up his own business. He first used a rented hall for his workshop but this hall was to small for the great number of clients he got so two years ago he received a bank loan and bought a plot on which he built his new larger garage. Now he needs some more money to finish upgrading his garage. The loan amount is $1200.

loans.use: To make repairs to his garage

loans.name: Beatriz Luz Elena

texts.en:
Beatriz is single and has a pretty 5 years old daughter. She could never count on her partner's help to cover her expenses, and therefore she has had to work hard to get ahead. To be able to spend more time with her daughter when she was born, she quit her job to start selling clothing and footwear. This has allowed her to have more free time and to always be with her daughter. Luckily, her business has thrived and her clientèle has grown.

Beatriz wants to continue to grow her business, and for this she needs a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise to offer a larger assortment to her clients, as well as to buy a showcase for her footwear. This will allow her to offer better service to her customers and to retain her client base.

You can help improve the quality of life for this family now; they thank you sincerely for your contribution.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Beatriz es soltera, y tiene una preciosa hija de 5 años de edad, nunca contó con el apoyo de su pareja para cubrir sus gastos, por lo que ha tenido que trabajar arduamente para sacarla adelante ella sola. Para dedicarle más tiempo a su niña, desde que nació, dejó el empleo que tenía para dedicarse a la venta de ropa y calzado, esta labor le ha permitido tener más tiempo y estar siempre al lado de su hija. Afortunadamente le ha ido bien en su negocio y se han incrementado sus clientes.

Pero Beatriz quiere continuar creciendo, para esto necesita de un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes, así como en la adquisición de un exhibidor de calzado, con esto espera brindar un mejor servicio y conservar la preferencia de sus clientes. Hoy puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellas agradecen sinceramente tu colaboración.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Mr. Edgar B. is 30 years old and lives with his common-law wife. He doesn't own his own home, but lives in a rented house. He has two children ages 2 and 4. For the past 10 years he has been building a career that enables him to support his family. As a mechanic, he has a workshop where he dedicates himself to the repair of motorcycles, a profession which he first learned as an apprentice and later through courses and certifications. In order to maintain a stock and offer good service to his clients, he will use the requested loan to buy spare parts and accessories.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El señor Edgar B. de 30 años vive en pareja, no posee casa propia por lo que vive en casa alquilada, tiene dos hijos de 2 y 4 años. Desde hace 10 años desarrolla una actividad que le permite mantener a su familia. Como mecánico tiene un taller donde se dedica a la reparación de motocicletas; profesión que aprendió como ayudante y luego realizó cursos y capacitaciones. A los efectos de mantener un stock y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, el crédito solicitado lo utilizará para la compra de repuestos y accesorios.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To replace all four tires on his lorry and to buy farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Zulma has been working as a hair stylist for 7 years. She is separated from her husband, and she has an 11 year old daughter named Macarena whom she supports and helps with her studies. Zulma began as an employee in a salon, and then later became the owner of her own salon in the zone of Villa Morra. She has been a client since 2004, when we granted her a loan to buy her business. After acquiring modern technology in her salon, she won many good clients. She has greatly improved her services and the quality of life for her and her daughter.

La Sra Zulma P. es peluquera hace 7 años , es separada , tiene una hija de 11 año que se llama Macarena a la que mantiene y le da sus estudios correspondientes, empezó siendo empleada y luego fue propietaria de su propio salón en la zona de Villa Morra , es cliente desde el 2004 , donde le dimos 15.000.000 para comprar una propiedad , después adquirió para su vehiculo y mucha tecnología moderna en su local con lo que gano muy buena clientela , gracias a nuestro apoyo mejoro notablemente sus servicios y su nivel de vida erias para así mejorar su nivel de vida y la de sus hijos . Manifestó que esta muy contenta de trabajar con nosotros por la atención y buenos servicios-

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her shop, including hair dye, bleach, shampoo and conditioner.

loans.name: Elnara

texts.en: Elnara lives in the Salyan region in the Khaladj village.  She was born in 1982 and is single.  Elnara has 4 years of experience in the farming business.  Now, she needs a loan of $1200 to buy vine props.

loans.use: to buy vine props

loans.name: Thi Lan

texts.vi:
Lan and her husband are owners of a woodshop, they make custom wood furniture. They're requesting a loan to expand their business, increase their production and be more competitive in the market.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Hai vợ chồng chị Lan làm chủ xưởng sản xuất đồ mỹ nghệ. Với số tiền vay Chương trình Tài chính vi mô, anh chị có thể mở rộng xưởng sản xuất của mình, nâng cao sức cạnh tranh trên thị trường.

loans.use: To expand their wood furniture business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 49 year old father of 6. He lives with his family in south Lebanon, in Tyre. Ibrahim is in the cattle business and also sells milk and yoghurt. He is doing the best he can to provide for his wife and children. Ibrahim needs a loan to buy livestock to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Mok

texts.en:
Mrs. Mok P., 31, has two children and sells food products for a living along with her husband. After cooking the foods, they sell their products in the market and earn approximately six dollars a day. To supplement the household income, they also rent rooms to local workers making, on average, about four dollars a day.
She would like to request a loan of $1000 from Kiva to purchase wood to repair her house and increase her rental income.

loans.use: To perform house repairs

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica A. is married with 3 children. She is 39 years of age and hails from Lambe community in Ogun State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and pepper soup. She has being in the business since 1994 and needs a loan in the sum of $1200 to enable her to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and pepper soup items for sale

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah A. is thirty-seven years old. She is married with four children who are currently in school. Hannah enjoys selling and she takes pride in meeting the needs of her customers. She owns and operates a grocery shop in the community market, selling items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, palm oil, peanuts, etc. With her good customer relation skills, Hannah has many customers buying from her shop. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of groceries to serve her customers. She belongs to the community group called Shepherd Trust Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing P. is 28 years old and is single with 2 children. She lives in Ilogbo, Lagos State. She has sold clothes since the year 2000 and she is also a fashion designer, a skill that she acquired 2 and a half years ago. Blessing is requesting a loan of $425 to buy a weaving machine. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy one weaving machine

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Oumar Diakhaté is a member of IMCEC’s Jammy Xaléyi fund in Thies, living in the Aynina Fall neighborhood. He is married and a father of three. He has been doing inner-city transport of goods for a few years and has benefited from two loans, which he successfully repaid. He is asking for this loan to repair his car in order to increase his income.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

oumar diakhaté est un sociétaire de la caisse de jammy xaleyi de imcec thies demeurant au quartier aynina fall.il est marié et père de trois enfants .il fait du transport inter urbain depuis quelques années et a bénéficié de deux prets qu'il a remboursé avec succès.c'est dans le but de réparer son véhicule qu'il sollicite cette somme en vue d'améliorer ses revenus .

loans.use: car repair

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Mrs. Run R. is 62 years old and lives in Makak Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who grows rice during the rainy reason and vegetables in the dry season. This is the rainy season, so Mrs. Run R. needs to cultivate rice, but unfortunately she does not have enough money to hire laborers to work in the field and to buy fertilizer for her crops. That is why she is applying for a loan to achieve these goals. Mrs. Run R. is a widow with five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend school.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work on her rice field and to buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is 54 years old, married and has 4 children. She lives in Lagos state. Florence sells tomatoes and peppers to her customers. She buys the tomatoes and peppers directly from farmers. She learned this business from her mother while she was growing up. She has been in this business for the past 5 years. Florence needs the loan to buy more tomatoes and peppers to sell. She says "Thank you."

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes for sale

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza, de 43 años de edad, tiene 8 hijos, 6 de ellos ya son independientes, quedando dos que estudian, es por eso que trabaja duro para brindarles el apoyo necesario.Ella se dedica a la venta de chupetes, hielos y gelatinas, que lleva a vender por las distintas zonas de la ciudad de Pucallpa, también vende verduras en un puesto del mercado, las que le generan ingresos suficientes para seguir adelante y mantener a su familia. Maritza es madre soltera y su afán de seguir creciendo con su negocio es motivado por sus hijos, quienes son su razón de vivir. Quiere superarse en este negocio complementándose con otros productos, para que logre todo esto, necesita de un capital. Apoya a esta madre luchadora, que trabaja duro por prosperar y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maritza is 43 years old and has 8 children, 6 of them who are already independent. The other two are still finishing their studies, and this is why Maritza is working hard to give them the necessary support. She works in the sale of candy, ice cream, and jelly, products she sells in different parts of the city Pucallpa. She also sells the most profitable vegetables; the money of all these sales is destined to improve her business and provide better opportunities for her children. Maritza is a single mom, and her intention of investing in her business further is motivated by the desire to keep helping her children. She wants to diversify her business by selling other products, and in order to do this, she needs an initial capital.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Diversify her sales by purchasing a wider variety of products

loans.name: Walter Daniel

texts.es:
Walter A. es originario de la ciudad de Managua y se dedica al negocio de pulpería o tienda general ubicada en un tramo del mercado Israel Lewites de la capital.

El desarrollo de su negocio lo debe a Ceprodel por lo que le ha brindado prestamos que los ha utilizado directamente en la compra de su mercadería para comercializarla. Una vez mas hoy acude a Ceprodel con la esperanza de que su crédito sea otorgado para continuar con su negocio y de esta forma llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación que tanto necesita de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Walter A. is originally from the city of Managua and had general store located in a section of the Israel Lewites market in the capitol. He developed his business thanks to Ceprodel, who have provided loans that he has used directly for the purchase of his merchandise to sell. Once again, he comes to Ceprodel with the hope that a loan will be granted to him so that he can continue his business and as such bring vital income home, where his support is very much needed.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita P. is active and busy cultivating her vegetable garden in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. At the age of 48 and with 6 lovely children, her eagerness to provide for her family through gardening is amazing. Juanita's husband raises cows and chickens and pastures goats in their own backyard. He also does fishing for more income.

They bring their produce to the market and sometimes sell it to people in their neighborhood. Juanita realizes that their main problem, being on their own, is their need for additional capital. That made her decide to reach out to Paglaum MPC for a loan of PHP 15,000.

Juanita hopes some day to own a fishing boat and build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer for her garden & fishing net and accessories

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Mrs. Phal H. was born in 1972 and lives in Khvet Village in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She owns two hectares of land and cultivates rice to earn a living. Her soil is infertile which reduces the amount of crops she is able to harvest. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Phal H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support thesoil and make her land more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Lim Nob, assists her on the plantation. Mrs. Phal H. has three children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve the soil, making her crop more productive.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: Clement A. is single and has no children. He has attended school through senior high. Clement melts metals and uses them to manufacture coal pots and locally made ovens. Coal pot is a of stove that burns charcoal as a fuel. He has done this work in Elmina, since 2004. Clement uses his income to pay for rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Clement will use the loan to increase his purchase of scrap metal and tools which will enable him to expand production. With the new profits from his expanded business, Clement plans to reinvest back into his business to improve his profit and enable him meet his financial responsibilities.

loans.use: To increase the purchase of scrap metal and buy tools to expand production.

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Bintou SANE est mariée, mère de 04 enfants scolarisés dont elle a la charge puisque son mari n’est présent au foyer que très rarement. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt réfectionner sa gargote et renforcer son activité de restauration. Elle pourra, de ce fait améliorer les conditions de vie familiale.
texts.en:
Bintou Sané is married and the mother of 4 children, all enrolled in school, for whom she is responsible since her husband is very rarely at home. She wants to use this loan to refurbish her luncheonette and bolster her little food service business. In this way she will be able to improve family living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: refurbish her luncheonette and stock up on raw materials for her food service

loans.name: Krishna Devi

texts.en:
Krishna Devi M. is a resident of Thecho. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur district. Most of the people in her region are engaged in farming.

Mrs. Krishna Devi M. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Thecho. She opened her grocery store a year ago to improve the living standard of her family. She sells different grocery items in her shop. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 8 and her daughter is in grade 3. Her son helps his mother in her grocery store.

Now Mrs. Krishna Devi M. is requesting Rs 10000 as a loan to buy various grocery items such as rice, maize, and snacks for her shop to expand her shop.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for re-sale

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr:
Dame S. Akouavi est une femme mariée âgée de 38 ans avec deux (2) enfants. Elle a pour activité principale, la vente des produits congelés. Ces derniers temps elle a épuisé son stock compte tenu des ventes qu’elle a eu à réaliser.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 7 cartons de poissons frais, et 9 cartons de poulets. 
Etant donnée qu’elle est la seule à vendre ces produits congelés dans la localité, elle n’aime pas avoir des ruptures de stock mais elle désire toujours satisfaire les clients et ainsi gagner des profits.
texts.en:
Mrs Akouavi S. is a 38-year old married woman with two children. Her main business activity is selling frozen goods. She has exhausted her inventory of late due to high sales levels. She is asking for her first loan to purchase 7 cartons of fresh fish and 9 cartons of chicken. Since she is the only one in the area selling frozen products, she does not like to run out of merchandise. She would rather satisfy her customers and thereby earn profits.

Translated from French by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Frozen Food Products

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is 40-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Khodor owns an electrical shop. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Khodor has requested a loan.

Khodor is special in his work because he knows how to treat his customers and he is the only one in his region. His customers are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the start-up capital. Khodor decided on doing his business because of his experience and because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on improving his shop.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es: Evelyn tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en la casa de su suegra. Desde hace 8 años trabaja de manera independiente vendiendo cosméticos, y hace poco comenzó empezó a vender ropa también. Diariamente visita de casa en casa a sus clientes en diferentes lugares de su ciudad. Evelyn reparte sus productos o ropa según solicitud, y luego va cobrando según haya convenido los plazos de pago, estos artículos los compra viajando cada cierto tiempo a diferentes ciudades. Ella misma se propone sus metas de venta porque posee la cualidad de perseverar aunque se sienta muy cansada por las largas caminatas que realiza. Hasta el momento su negocio le ha dado buenos frutos que le permiten ser un sostén más en su hogar y para el futuro su deseo es seguir adelante con este negocio y establecerse en un local comercial o un puesto de ventas. Es la primera vez que Evelyn tiene la experiencia de trabajar en un banco comunal, para ella es un gran desafío, porque ha escuchado que es un trabajo muy comprometido. El dinero que viene solicitando es poder la compra de más mercadería en prendas de vestir y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in her mother-in-law's home. For the last eight years Evelyn has sold cosmetics and recently began selling clothing as well. Every day she goes from house to house visiting her customers in different neighborhoods of the city. Evelyn takes orders for clothing and cosmetics and, once the orders are paid in full, she delivers them. She purchases her merchandise by traveling every so often to different cities. Evelyn creates her own sales goals, since she is very driven despite being exhausted from the long distances she must walk.

So far, Evelyn's business has been successful and has enabled her to provide economic support to her household. She hopes to continue developing this business and one day have a store or stall from which to sell her merchandise. This is the first time that Evelyn has worked with a community bank, and for her it is a great challenge, as she has heard that it is very involved work. She will use the money from this loan to purchase more clothing and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 29 years old Mary W. from Tukuyu. She is married with 2 children, between the ages of 2 and 8. Mary has been running a charcoal business since 2006.

Mkaa (Charcoal), is small, black pieces of dry earth that is used by many Tanzanians as a fuel to cook their daily meals. Women cook food in small coal pots, in which they arrange the charcoal, and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them.

Because there is such a high demand for charcoal across the country, being a charcoal seller is quite lucrative. Mary works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. She currently earns about US $120 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Mary thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy charcoal in bulk for resale

loans.name: Pabla Petrona

texts.es: Pabla Petrona Gómez tiene 43 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos y la actividad económica a la que ella esta dedicada es a la venta de mercadería en general, ella se inicia en este rubro siendo una madre abandonada pero que con mucho valor decidió enfrentar su situación e invirtió unos ahorros que tenia en la compra de mercadería, de esta manera pudo hacer clientela quienes le compraban al contado y al crédito, al principio fue un poco difícil, pues sus niños estaban pequeños y ella no tenia clientes fijos por lo que tenia que caminar largos trechos para conseguirlos. Ella nunca opto por dejar a sus hijos, ya que siempre ha sido una madre muy responsable y cuidadosa, gracias a Dios ella ha podido enfrentar todo lo que ha su vida se ha aproximado, y hoy en día se siente muy satisfecha por su valentía y ánimos de luchar por la vida. Ella desea un financiamiento para invertir en su capital de trabajo donde el inventario de más urgencia que necesita son: zapatos, cosméticos, pantalones, ropa para niños, perfumes, entre otras.
texts.en:
Pabla Petrona G., 43, has 2 children and operates a business selling general merchandise. She started the business when she was abandoned, already a mother, but facing her situation with great bravery and investing some savings that she had in the purchase of merchandise for resale. She then built a customer base, some buying from her with cash and others on credit. At first, it was a bit difficult since her children were small and she didn't have a regular customer base that she could depend on. She had to walk long stretches to find customers. She never chose to leave her children because she's always been a responsible and caring mother. Happily, she's managed to face all that life has thrown at her and she's pleased that she's found the strength and courage to do it. She wants a loan for working capital which she'll use to buy the products that she most urgently needs: shoes, cosmetics, pants, children's clothes and perfumes, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Blyth

texts.en: Blyth L. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 30 years old, single, and has four school-aged children. Blyth owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Blyth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Gloria Epifania

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Kutimuy que significa Regresa en quechua.
Gloria es casada, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Gloria junto a su esposo e hijos se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos en telares, producen pasadizos, frazadas, productos que envía a la ciudad de Cuzco y también en los mercados de la ciudad de ayacucho. Además Gloria tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa.
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lanas, tintes.
Los sueños de Gloria son progresar y ser una gran empresaria, sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Kutimuy -- which means "return" in quechua -- community bank. Gloria is married, is 33 years old and has three children. Alongside her husband and children, Gloria is dedicated to weaving on looms. They produce "pasadizos" (textiles that can cover tables, chairs or floors) and blankets, products that they send to the city of Cuzco and also to the markets in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Gloria has a small shop in her home. Gloria needs a loan of 1,400 soles which will be invested in the purchase of wool and dye. Gloria's dreams are to progress and be a great entrepreneur and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of wool and dye.

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en: Liliosa M. is from the town of Panaon. She is 49 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Liliosa owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Liliosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Liliosa is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German M. R. es un  señor de 44  años de edad quien vive con su esposa en una comunidad llamada El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que azotan la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. 

Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en la Zona Atlántica de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado, por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona y de esta forma evitar migrar.

Como parte de las respuestas a esa situación, desde hace dos años se instaló en la comunidad una planta de elaboración de quesos, propiedad de la Asociación de Productores de Leche de El Sauce, hecho que motivó a don German a iniciar en la producción de leche para luego venderla a esta planta. 

Asegura que su familia  se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante mucho tiempo, por lo que ha podido experimentar todos los cuidados que demanda, además de la instrucción recibida por parte de sus familiares  a lo largo del tiempo. 

El queso de la región donde vive don German es famoso en todo Costa Rica. Es un queso fresco que se le conoce tradicionalmente como “queso tipo Turrialba”. A los “ticos” (como se les conoce a los habitantes de Costa Rica) les gusta mucho consumir este producto; se le encontrará en las mesas acompañando cualquier tipo de comida.  Por esta razón, el mercado para dicho producto es realmente bueno.

Don German desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera y poder iniciar con su negocio ya que desea ser un microempresario exitoso y  así poder ayudar a que su familia siga adelante esto es una de las cosas que lo motiva a esforzarse y trabajar con mucho esmero.

Don German es socio de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
German M. R. is 44 and lives with his wife in a community called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba in the province of Cartago. This is a small rural community of approximately 2,000 people. Its residents are dedicated to milk production and to growing coffee. It has an irregular landscape, and much of the land is maintained as tropical forests. The community has very picturesque landscapes that combine the tropical forest with lovely lakes, coffee plantations, and dairy farms. El Sauce is located approximately an hour and a half from Turrialba, the nearest commercial center. However, several times a year, the road becomes impassable due to the rains that slam the region. This is without a doubt one of the biggest challenges for the community. When there weren't a lot of jobs in the area, many people opted to go out looking for work in Turrialba or at banana farms located in the Atlantic region of Costa Rica. Currently the prices of coffee and milk have improved, so neighbors are looking to invest in projects in this region to avoid having to migrate to find work. As part of the answer to this situation, two years ago, a cheese factory was built in the community. It belongs to El Sauce's Association of Milk Producers. This has motivated German to start producing milk to sell to this plant. He assures us that his family has been dedicated to this work for a long time, which is why he has been able to experiment with all of the work that it demands. He has also received training from his family members for a long time now. The cheese that comes from the region where German lives is famous throughout Costa Rica. It's a fresh cheese that is traditionally knowh as "Turrialba cheese." "Ticos" (the name given to people from Costa Rica) like this product a lot, and it can be found on tables accompanied by any type of food. For this reason, the market for this product is very good. German hopes to obtain a microcredit of 500,000 colones to buy a dairy cow and to be able to start his business. He hopes to be a successful microbusinessman and to be able to help his family get ahea. This is one of the things that motivates him to work very hard and very carefully. German is a member of the Producers Association of El Sauce, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan, and he hopes to continue growing at a personal and economic level. He also stresses that he is thankful to this type of organization and easier ways to access credit so he can dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: United Group

texts.en:
United Group is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Kebbeh M., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Kebbeh is married with 5 children, ages 6-15.  None of these children are able to attend school.  Kebbeh is 36 years old, illiterate, and lives in Borkeza Town.  

Kebbeh’s business is selling palm oil wholesale.  Palmoil is used for cooking and making soap.  Kebbeh sells in the Bokeza market in a stall alongside other vendors.  She has been running her business for 3 years.  Today her business is only open when she has inventory, even though the demand is constant.  She’s taking a loan to increase her inventory sufficiently so she can keep her business open year-round.  She treats her customers so well that she believes they will come to her year-round from adjacent villages.  With the profits she will invest in the future of her kids, especially in education since she was unable to attend school.

loans.use: Purchasing palm oil

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante R. runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling food and daily use products in his community. He is 40 years old, married and has five school-age children. They are from the village of Saray, Iligan City. Dante has been in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Dante joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dante is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es:
La señora EMERITA, tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN LUIS  y presenta estudios hasta 4to de Primaria. Se caso a la edad de 16 años y tiene 3 hijos todos menores y se encuentran estudiando por lo cual dependen económicamente de ella . EMERITA se dedica a la plantación de eucalipto (planta medicinal) en la chacra de caratas para luego venderlo al por mayor en su pueblo y en pueblos aledaños . Con su  primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró semillas, abono y bolsas para la plantación.
Con este crédito de 300  nuevos soles comprará sacos de abono, semillas y bolsas para la plantación de su eucalipto. La socia sueña con tener una buena cosecha y así obtener dinero para su gastos y estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Emerita is 35 years old, lives in the Trujillo district, province of Trujillo, in the city of La Libertad - Peru. She is a member of the San Luis Community Bank and has a 4th grade education. She was married at 16 years of age and has 3 children who are economically dependent on her. Emerita works at planting eucalyptus (which is a medicinal plant) on a farm and then sells it wholesale in her town and surrounding villages. With her first loan of 300 soles ($125 USD), she bought seeds, fertilizer and bags, which helps her in the planting of eucalyptus. With this loan, she plans to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer, seeds and bags for her eucalyptus business. Emerita dreams of having a good harvest, so that she can bring in money for their expenses and for her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprará sacos de abono, semillas y bolsas para la plantación de su eucalipto (To purchase fertilizer, seed and bags for her eucalyptus business)

loans.name: Rogert

texts.en:
Rogert is a client of Asociación Arariwa. He is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Anta. The group is called Virgen Inmaculada Concepcion. He is from Anta and lives in Cusco. He is 51 years old and is married with three children.

Rogert has been working as a metal mechanic in a compressor factory for 20 years. He owns 5 machines that are utilized in the mining industry, and he will use the loan to maintain them.

Rogert appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To maintain his mining machines

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
Lelia D., 62, is a widow from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan De Oro City. She has one adult-aged child. For over five years, Lelia has owns and operates a business that make and sells specialty food products in her local community. Lelia earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lelia joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lelia is requesting the same amount now to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 
-------------------------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Oluyemi

texts.en: Oluyemi makes a living selling bags of cement in both wholesale and retail markets in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She is 43 years old, married and has four children. Her husband is a lecturer and both he and his wife work very hard. Oluyemi has been in her line of work for three years, and has applied for a loan for 50,000 NGN to buy more bags of cement to sell. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement to sell

loans.name: Oluayo

texts.en:
Oluayo is 41 years old. He is married with 4 children, the eldest 12 years old. His children are still dependent on him and they go to school. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. His wife sells foodstuffs to support the home. Oluayo sells shoes to make a living. He has been in this business for a long time. This is the high season for business and he hopes to make more profit.

Oluayo is an LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. Oluayo is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more shoes to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 52-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. He has owned a grocery store since 2004, where he sells candies, canned food, home cleaning products, etc. Hussein requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase merchandise for his store. He has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his business by diversifying his merchandise and offering more products.
Hussein is successful in his work because he opens early in the morning and closes late in the evening. His customers are friends, neighbors, and traders. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase a lot of merchandise, and had difficulty finding the proper place to open his store. Hussein started his business because he has experience in trading. In future, he plans to improve his store further.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Koeuth

texts.en: Koeuth K. is a 49-year-old and a resident of Kompong Tom province, where she earns a living by raising many pigs in a stall next to her house.  In addition, she has a small plot of land where her husband plants different kinds of crops, including potatoes and rice. Koeuth K. has three school-aged kids and another two who are employed. Due to the fact that the pig-breeding trade is very profitable, Koeuth K. would like a loan to buy pig feed and more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Aurora's Group

texts.en: Aurora M. is from the village of Ugad. She is 45 years old and is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. The official name of this borrowing group is Aurora M.. Aurora is married and has five adult children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seventeen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Aurora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sophion

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophion K. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. She is the mother of two children, one of whom is attending school while the younger one is too young for school because this child is only 2 years old. Her husband, Mr. Chum Pros, is a motorbike taxi driver who earns a small income to support the family. They live in Ping Pong village in Takeo province. 

With the farm, Mrs. Sophion K. faces a problem because her field is far from an irrigation system, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine to pump water for her crop. She will use the rest of the money to dig a well for her family to use. 

Her husband is present on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a water machine to pump water for her crop

loans.name: Las Catarritas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Catarritas está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la joven Blanca Zenobia Hernández O. la cual en sus inicios comercializaba sandalias  pero luego decidió cambiar de negocio y con dos mil córdobas invirtió en la compra de prendas y cosméticos.

Sus compañeras de grupo son María Cecilia Z. F. la cual vende ropa, cosméticos y prenda mientras María de los Santos G. López vende caramelos y chiverías. Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus respectivos negocios con el propósito de ampliarlo.
texts.en:
The "Las Catarritas" group is composed of three, hard-working women. One of them is Blanca Zenobia Hernández O., who started off selling sandals, but then decided to change focus and, with a 2000 córdobas investment, bought articles of clothing and cosmetics. Her fellow group members are: María Cecilia Z. F., who sells clothing and cosmetics and María de los Santos G. López, who sells sweets and yoghurt snacks. They will invest the funds in their respective businesses, the goal being to enlarge them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gold and silver jewelry items, cosmetics, clothing.

loans.name: Irène Flore

texts.fr: Née en 1965 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, D. Irène Flore est mariée à HOUENOU Filbert, un imprimeur. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés. Il y a près de deux ans que Irène Flore s'est installée à Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Les différentes charges de la famille sont supportées par Irène Flore et son mari. Irène Flore n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Depuis 26 ans, Irène Flore mène comme activité, la vente de tissus et des ustensiles de cuisine, de façon ambulante. Cette activité lui procure des revenus qui l'aident à subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Irène Flore s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Irène Flore désire augmenter le stock de ses produits et rehausser ainsi son activité, afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. Compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose, Irène Flore sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, Irène Flore D. is married to Filbert HOUENOU, a printer. The couple has two children, both at school. Almost two years ago Irène Flore settled down in Agblangandan, in the town of Sème-Podji. The various family expenses are covered by both Irène Flore and her husband. Irène Flore attended primary school only. For the past twenty-six years she has had a business selling fabrics and kitchen equipment on a door-to-door basis. This business procures an income which helps her to provide for her needs and those of her children. Irène Flore gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market in Bénin. She would like to increase her stock and thereby expand her business, in order to respond better to customer demand. In view of the limited financial means which she has, Irène Flore is applying for a first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics and kitchen equipment (sets of bowls, basins etc.)

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida S. is from the village of Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Brigida is engaged in the agriculture sector, particularly in hog raising. Through this activity she is able to earn a monthly net income amounting to 4,000.00. 

In 2004, Brigida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Brigida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Brigida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will also be used as additional capital. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Brigida from PMPC. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog raising.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay N., 38, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. (N.'s husband appears in the photograph.)

She sells groceries for an income of about $7 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $6.90 per day to help cover the family expenses. N. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Jambalnyambuu

texts.en:
Jambalnyambuu T. is 52 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. 

Her husband, Bayrsaihan, operates a transportation business in their town. They have been living together in their current home for 10 years. 

Jambalnyambuu operates a vegetable trading business in town. She has been operating this business since 1998, and has steadily expanded. She rents a counter at a local trading center. She has gained significant experience over the past 12 years. She started her business with a working capital of 60,000 MNT. However, with a lot hard work and determination, she has managed to increase her working capital to 1,600,000 MNT.  

With her business profits, she has been saving money to build a house for her family. Jambalnyambuu is an open and very hardworking person. She says, “I would like to expand my business. My dream is one day to create my own workplace. ”  She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more vegetables to resell to her many customers.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth G. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Lilibeth is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lilibeth owns & operates a business venture selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Lilibeth has been engaged in her business for less than a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lilibeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more fish to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lilibeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:
