The five women of the Association Femme Développement Entreprise Numéro 14 group have an average age of 35 and live in big traditional extended families in the "Parcelles Assainies" neighborhood in Thiès, a town 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal.

They met through living in the same neighborhood or being related. They have various businesses, for example, selling costume jewelry, perfume and clothing, and also ice cream, juice, etc. They have a lot of experience and are much sought after in these activities.

Wishing to improve the quality of their services and expand their businesses, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution IMCEC. They have already received one group loan through IMCEC and have reimbursed it correctly. They intend to use this loan to build up their stocks of merchandise.

Women's clothing in West Africa is a part of essential culture, and all women wear brightly colored clothing, so the sales of clothing and jewelry are going strong. It is very hot in Thiès, so there is plenty of demand for ice cream and juice as well. The merchandise of this group is sold retail, for cash, in the big market of Thiès.

They hope to make an average profit of 30,000 F CFA during this loan cycle which will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and cover family needs, investing the rest back into their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of jewelry, clothing, perfume, juice, and ice cream for re-sale

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela es socia del Banco Comunal Palmeras.
Marianela es soltera, tiene 32 años y vive con sus padres, Marianela tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado, la atención es todos los días, atiende eventos y compromisos familiares, los días sábados y domingos vende comida típica. Además Marianela junto a su novio tienen cabinas de Internet.
Marianela necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne, arroz, maíz.
Los sueños de Marianela son tener un local propio y tener un hotel.
texts.en:
Marianela is a member of the Palmeras Communal Bank. Marianela is 32 years old, unmarried, and lives with her parents. Marianela has a restaurant in a rented space and works there every day, helping to host events and family occasions, especially on Saturdays and Sundays. She serves traditional local food. Also, Marianela runs an internet cafe with her boyfriend. Marianela needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will use to buy meat, rice and corn. Marianela dreams of owning her own space and of running a hotel.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, rice and corn

loans.name: Tusajigwe

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is twenty-four-year-old Tusajigwe M. from Tukuyu. She is married  and has a two-year-old child. Tusajigwe has been running a used clothing business since 2006. She works at her business for nine to twelve hours a day, six days a week, and currently earns about $120 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes in bulk. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Tusajigwe thanks you for your support.


ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, which enables them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Socos Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Socos, el Banco inicia su tercer ciclo con 18 socias. Las socias son del distrito D. Socos.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, cereales, comidas, ropa, animales menores, frutas, la agricultura y la elaboración D. telares.
	
Como es el caso D. Elva que es separada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Elva venD. cereales en la ciudad D. Pisco a donD. viaja semanalmente, los cereales los compra en su distrito. Además Elva se dedica a la agricultura D. papa, arveja y haba.
	
Mientras que Florentina es casada, tiene 28 años y 3 hijos, Florentina junto a su familia tienen un taller D. telar y bordados, realizan trabajos como carteras, tapetes, sus ventas lo realiza en el mercado artesanal D. la ciudad.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 13,000 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arveja, haba, lana, arroz, fideo, azúcar, trigo, cebada, animales menores.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios , comprar un carro para transportar sus productos, tener un puesto estable y construir su casa.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Socos is beginning its 3rd cycle with 18 members. The members come from the Socos district. The members all have different jobs, such as grocery sales, food sales, clothing sales, small animal sales, and agriculture sales. Take the case of Elva, for example, who is 30 years old and separated with 2 children. Elva sells basic grains in the city of Pisco, where she travels weekly. She purchases the grains in her district. In addition, Elva also grows potatoes and peas. Florentina is 28 years old and married with 3 children. Florentina and her family have a weaving workshop, where they make items such as rugs, which they sell in the city's artesanal market. The bank members need different loan amounts, such as 300, 600, and 900 Soles, combining for a grand total of 13,000 Soles for the Communal Bank. The money will be invested in the purchase of peas, wool, rice, noodles, sugar, wheat, and small animals. The members' dreams are that their children can complete their studies, to purchase a car to transport their products, and to construct a house.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase peas, wool, rice, noodles, sugar, wheat, and small animals.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is engaged in running a typical village store in the rural village of San Jose Norte 1. She is married to Hilario D.. They were blessed with four children; three of them have successfully finished their studies and now have decent jobs. Her youngest is still in high school. Virgina is also hoping that her youngest will be able to graduate college and have her own stable job some day.

Virginia patiently maintains her village store in order to pay for the education of her youngest child through the daily income generated from the business. To further increase her income, Virginia is requesting the amount of PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders to buy added merchandise to sell in the store.

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es: Ezequiel Hernández R. tiene 32 años de edad. Hace 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de pinturas y enderezado. Ezequiel empezó como ayudante en un taller, por lo que fue aprendiendo muy bien este oficio, Ezequiel tiene mucho carisma para atender a sus clientes, por lo que decide establecer su propio negocio, y así con la ayuda de su familia han logrado mantener este negocio, por lo que su mayor desafío es que cada día hay mucha gente en este negocio, pero todo depende de la muy buena administración. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materiales de pinturas automotrices, y otros productos utilizados en su taller. Su deseo es acondicionar su negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Ezequiel Hernández R. is 32 years old and has been in business for 6 years. He provides paint and auto body repair services. Ezequiel began as an assistant at another shop where he learned this line of work. He is very charismatic and enjoys dealing with customers, which is why he decided to go into business for himself. His family has helped him maintain the business, but he says the greatest challenge is dealing with too many people and that success lies in having good administration skills.

The loan he is requesting will be used as working capital to purchase automotive paints and other products used in his workshop. His desire is to upgrade his business so that he can provide better service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda I. is from the village of Biasong. She is 56 years old. Erlinda is married and has six adult children. Erlinda operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (about $104) a month for these activities.

In 2007, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Erlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ana Ros

texts.es:
La señora Ana es socia del Banco Comunal “6 de Enero”, en el distrito de de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 36 años de edad y actualmente es soltera, y se encuentra al cuidado de 02 hijos, ella pudo estudiar sus estudios superiores pero no los concluyó, vine en la Av. Panamericana.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de comida, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para adquirir insumos para la preparación de comida. 

Ella desea continuar con su negocio, por ello requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, con lo que aumentara al capital de su restaurante y comprar  arroz, carne, fideos, papa, etc..

Su deseo es ampliar su local  preferentemente en una gran quinta.

A ella le gustan mucho las reuniones ya que en ellas se distrae mucho con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Señora Ana is a member of the "6 de Enero" community bank in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 36 years old, single, and cares for two children. She attended high school but was not able to finish. She lives on Av. Panamericana. Ana has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. She buys and sells food. Her first loan of S/. 300 nuevos soles ($125) allowed her to acquire products used in food preparation. Ana wants to continue with her business, and for that she requests an additional S/. 300 nuevos soles to be able to increase the capital of her restaurant and to buy products such as rice, meat, pastas, and potatoes. Her goal is to expand her restaurant space, preferably on to a large estate. Ana really likes her group meetings for how much she and her partners can enjoy themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, meat, pastas, potatoes, etc. for her restaurant

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie J. is a pig farmer. She likes pigs very much, and that is why she has made them her business for quite a long time now. In 2007, she began to raise one piglet, and increased to two, three and now five pigs. She sells each pig for PHP 9,000 each, and she says that hog raising is a very feasible business to gain income with.
She would like to request a loan of PHP 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy piglets and piglet feed. The loan is truly worthwhile because she currently doesn't have enough money to support her piggery, and receiving a loan will save her business from suffering. 

She likes the services of CEVI so much. She says, "In CEVI, clients receive not just loans, but education as well."

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
T.Oyuntsetseg is a lathe operator who received her secondary education. In accordance with her occupation, she started her repair business in 1995 with the help of her husband. They live with their three daughters in a ger (Mongolian nomadic dwelling) in the Chingeltei District of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. This nomadic dwelling is quite small for 5 people.

They have a dream to buy more gers for their children when they get married and have their own lives. The oldest daughter studies at the Nursing College in order to become a very good nurse and help others. The other two daughters go to high school and study very hard in order to further their education and help their parents.

Oyuntsetseg's business is repairing and welding cars and iron goods. They also produce hand-made iron goods, such as chairs and shelves. With the iron goods, they earn 200,000 tugrug (~141 USD) and by repairing cars they earn approximately 300,000 to 500,000 tugrug (~210 USD - 350 USD) in a month. Since the start if the business, they have gained a great reputation among their customers. There is no one in their area unacquainted with them.

When people say "Huyga's home", everyone knows about whom they are talking. "It is significant to be good at one's occupation," says Oyuntsetseg, and that is true for everyone. They want to expand their business on behalf of their children's future. She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100 USD) loan to maintain and expand her car repair business.

loans.use: to maintain and expand her car repair business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane owns a tailoring and embroidery business in Nairobi. A 30 year old widow and mother to five, Jane hopes to own a successful company for manufacturing and exporting trousers. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 30,000 to help her purchase more stock of raw materials. She describes herself as diligent and committed. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Eulogia es una socia dinámica y activa, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, región D. Ucayali, tiene 63 años madre D. seis hijos todos mayores D. edad, Eulogia se dedica a la venta D. leche fresca, queso y manjar blanco (dulce D. leche), ella venD. sus productos en el mercado Nro 2  D. esta localidad, su es poso esta delicado D. salud por lo que ahora ella sola trabaja para salir adelante. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Productivas” desD. hace ocho años, el primer crédito que obtuvo en este banco fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en frutas.
Actualemnte ella requiere un crédito D. 1300 soles que será utilizado para comprar insumos para la elaboración D. yogurt, manjar blanco.  La meta D. Eulogia es tener una tienda para vender estos productos,  ya que ella venD. en el exterior del mercado y no tiene un local establecido.
texts.en:
Eulogia is a dynamic and active member of CrediMUJER. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 63 years old and the mother of 6 grown children.

Eulogia’s business is the sale of fresh milk, cheese, and manjar blanco (a Peruvian sweet milk dish). She sells her products in the local market. Because her husband is in bad health, she is the only one providing for the family.

For 8 years, Eulogia has been a member of the Communal Bank’s “Productive Women.” Her first loan with this bank was for 300 soles, which she used to buy fruit. This loan, for 1300 soles, will be used for supplies to make yogurt and manjar blanco.

Eugenia’s goal is to have her own store to sell her products. Currently she has to sell outsiD. the market and does not have a permanent location.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: supplies for making yogurt and manjar blanco

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia MARINA, pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO DE LOS ANDES”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 59 años de edad, es viuda, tiene 5 hijos (cuadro mujeres y un varón), ellos trabajan y estudian. Ella tiene un negocio familiar donde todos sus hijos apoyan, la actividad comercial de la socia es de lunes a sábado es vender ropa y artefactos en el centro comercial “El Molino”, el día domingo vende y compra artesanía en la ciudad de Chincheros en el Cusco, la artesanía lo compra de los hermanos pues ellos son artesanos, la socia necesita el crédito para poder comprar más ropa (jeans) de la ciudad de Lima pues así aumentar  más la venta en esta navidad que esta próxima y también aumentar la venta de artesanías que es bien solicitada por los turistas que llegan a la ciudad Imperial del Cusco.
  
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
MARINA, 59, is a member of the "PROGRESO DE LOS ANDES" (PROGRESS OF THE ANDES) communal bank and is from the city of Cusco. She is a widow and has 5 children (four girls and one boy) who work and are students. She has a family business where her children all participate that consists of selling clothing and handicrafts Monday through Saturday at the "El Molino" market . On Sundays, she buys and sells handicrafts in the city of Chincheros in Cusco. She buys the crafts from the brothers who are artisans. She needs these funds to buy more clothes (jeans) in Lima so that she can increase her sales this Christmas season which is near and also to increase the sale of handicrafts which are in high demand by the tourists who come to the Imperial City of Cusco. She is grateful for the opportunity offered in this manner and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and handicrafts for resale.

loans.name: Armeda

texts.en:
Armeda V. is from the village of Libertad, Misamis Oriental. She is 70 years old. Armeda is widowed and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Armeda owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling green bananas to the community. Armeda has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Armeda joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Armeda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Armeda is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP. The money will be used to purchase new items to expand the number of products offered. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Armeda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing new items to expand the number of products offered

loans.name: Karegyeya Ainomugisha Fiona Group

texts.en: A. Fiona is the chairperson of her group. She is using the loan to purchase pub items such as crates of beers, sodas, and so forth to sell. She has been in her business for over two years. At least now she buys more than five crates of sodas, beers, boxes of water, wines, and so forth. She is stocking more and more for better profits. She is an active and hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase pub items to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. is married and has four children. She has completed junior high school. Esther sells gari, maize, and groundnuts at Teterem near Elmina, which she has been doing since 2004. Her husband is a plumber. Esther uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Esther will use the loan to purchase gari, maize, groundnuts and other food supplies for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esther plans to use it to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase gari, maize, groundnuts and other food supplies for sale.

loans.name: Noun

texts.en: Mrs. Noun P. is 50 years old, and she lives in Prey Buy village in Takeo province. She lives with her husband, Dy Vong, and five children. One of them works in a garment factory; the other four are students. Mrs Noun P. is a farmer who owns a small field on which she grows rice. Her husband is a laborer who can make a small income to support the family. She is asking for a loan from the Kiva field partner, AMK, to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for cultivating rice.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for cultivating rice.

loans.name: Ezel

texts.en:
Ezel J. is from the village of Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental.  She is 28 years old, married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Ezel owns & operates a business venture of NFA retailer. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling NFA rice in the local community. Ezel has been engaged in her business for 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Ezel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ezel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ezel is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Ezel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model).

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase additional inventory & working capita

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon S. is from the village of Poblacion, 1 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 44 years old. Marlon is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marlon owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a mini-pharmacy selling different kinds of medicine in the local community. Marlon has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marlon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 60,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marlon is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Marlon from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marguérite Agnès

texts.fr: T. Marguérite Agnès est née le 28 Avril 1959 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Mariée à MEVI Noël un comptable, Marguérite Agnès est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Marguérite Agnès a deux autres enfants à charge, en plus de ses enfants. Marguérite Agnès vit avec ses enfants au quartier Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. C'est depuis 8 ans que Marguérite Agnès s'est installée dans ce quartier. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Marguérite Agnès a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Il y a environs 5 ans que Marguérite Agnès vend des tissus à son domicile et aussi par le système de distribution. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Marguérite Agnès s'approvisionne. Marguérite Agnès a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. La clientèle de Marguérite Agnès s'accroît au jour le jour et elle n'arrive plus à tous les satisfaire compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose. En vue d'augmenter le stock de ses produits, pour de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire, Marguérite Agnès sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Marguérite Agnès T. was born on April 28, 1959 in Ouidah, historic town of Benin. She is married to Noël Mevi, an accountant; Marguérite Agnès is the mother of four children, all in school. In addition to her own children, she is financially responsible for two other children. She lives with her children in the neighborhood of Dogoudo in Allada, in the department of the Atlantic. Marguérite Agnès settled in this neighborhood eight years ago. Together the couple provides for the family. Marguérite Agnès stopped attending school at the secondary level. She has been selling fabric from her home and through the distribution system for about five years. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and in Nigeria, a neighboring state of Benin. Marguerite Agnès has already obtained two loans from ALIDé that she has fully reimbursed. Her clientele is increasing from day to day and she can no longer meet their needs given the few financial means that she has. Marguérite Agnès is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. in order to increase her stock, to better meet her customers’ demand and to increase her turnover.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 25 bolts of cloth

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es:
Zenovia es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Zenovia es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Zenovia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende verduras, abarrotes en general, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Zenovia necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gas, arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Zenovia son tener mas capital, comprar un carro para que trabaje su esposo e implementar con mas vitrinas su negocio.
texts.en:
Zenovia is a member of the Anabella Community Bank. She is 30 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children. Zenovia has a store in her house where she sells vegetables, meat, and groceries; an activity that she performs every day. Zenovia needs a loan of PEN 2500 that she will invest in the purchase of gas, rice, and sugar. Her dreams are to have more capital to buy a car so that her husband can work and to install more counters in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase gas, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Jumoke

texts.en:
Jumoke is 45 years old, married and has 3 children aged 10, 12, and 13. Her husband is a trader and they all reside in Lagos state, Nigeria.
 
Jumoke has a shop; she sells drinks to her costumers at wholesale and retail prices. She has been in this business for 15 years now. She buys directly from the company sales representative. She hopes to expand her business by buying more drinks to sell and to have another shop. 

She is asking for a loan of NGN 170,000 to purchase more drinks to sell to increase her profit. She promises to pay back by the due date and she says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is widowed. She has one adult son. Oksana sells women's clothing at village markets. Her monthly income today is about 6,000 UAH.

Oksana started this business 14 years ago, when she saw a demand for clothing outside of her town, in local villages. She began to travel out to these villages offering women's clothing. The clients were thankful because they did not want to spend their time going to the town to buy clothing. This business became a stable source of income for Oksana and her growing son.

Oksana would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to increase the assortment. She wants to offer a larger variety to her clients to satisfy their demands.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul Kinyanjui K. is twenty-one years old. He is single and has no children yet. He provides motorcycle transport in the Kiganjo area in Thika. Kiganjo is mainly a busy residential area in Thika.  Paul's business is well known by the name Boda Boda-Kimuchu. He has been in this business for three years now and he plans to buy another motorbike to grow his business. That is why he is requesting a 20,000 KES loan. 

Paul has plans to purchase land, find a wife, have children and build a house for his family. He is very hardworking and he is determined to meet his goals in life.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Latif

texts.ru: Умурзоков Латиф проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст, 43 года. Женат, имеет 8 детей. Образование - высшее "Инженер". По профессии работал более 10 лет. Кроме того Латиф открыл чайхану (столовую), где работает вместе с семей. В этой области более 4 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения мебели. Латиф хочет закупить столы и стулья.
texts.en:
Latif U. lives in the Rudaki district. He is 43 years old, married and has 8 children. He has a higher education with a specialty in engineering. He spent over 10 years working in his profession. Besides this, Latif opened opened a tea-house cafe, where he works together with his family. He has been in this field for over 4 years. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of furniture. Latif wants to buy tables and chairs.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of furniture

loans.name: Titus

texts.en: Titus is 54 years old, married and has two children. He sells coffins to earn a living. He started this business five years ago and has employed one person. He also does farming for more income. He joined Masaku Ushindi group so as to access a loan from Faulu Kenya. This is because the group members guarantee each other's loans. He has requested for a loan of KES25,000 to buy timber for making coffins. He hopes to build a house for his family, in the future.(The photo shows his wood vanishes in the background).

loans.use: To buy timber for making coffins.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana lives with her family in Multan, Pakistan, a city of tombs and holy places. She helps her husband in his business of selling milk. She is also a good mother who is bringing up her children very well. They both get up early and get milk from their buffalo. Then her husband goes to milk shops to sell it. In this way they generate income for their family.  

Presently, they have one buffalo, but it has started giving less milk. As inflation is increasing day by day, one buffalo is insufficient for meeting their financial expenses.  Therefore, Farzana has applied for a loan from Asasah so they will be able to buy another buffalo so they can sell its milk to more customers and increase their profits.  Earning more income will help them improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase another buffalo for milking

loans.name: Laura Dalila

texts.es:
Laura Dalila D. Q. tiene 26 años.  Es  soltera y vive con su hija, Emily de 9 meses, en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.

Laura es una socia de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa, que está ubicada a una hora y media del cantón Chillanes.  Son 18 socios en total, que en la mayoridad tienen sus propios negocios. Esto es el primer  préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Laura se dedica a la venta de comida: tiene un restaurante propio. Hace las compras cada día en el comisariato El Ahorro de Bucay

Solicita el préstamo para ampliar su restaurante e invertir en mercadería para su negocio. Su sueño es  que su negocio crezca cada día más y llegar a hacer una gran empresaria con éxito. Enfrenta desafíos para mejorar el negocio y ser mejor que la competencia. 

Quisiera agradecer la Cooperativa San Jose por ayudarles con los créditos, para mejorar sus negocios y cumplir sus sueños de tener sus negocios propios.
texts.en:
Laura Dalila D. Q. is 26 years old. She is single and lives with her daughter Emily, who is 9 months old, in the Chillanes canton of Bolivar province. Laura is a member of the communal bank "Santa Rosa," which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 18 members in all, and the majority of them have their own businesses. This is the first loan that they have taken from the Cooperativa San José. Laura sells food; she has her own restaurant. She makes purchases every day in the "El Ahorro de Bucay" cooperative store. She requests a loan to expand her restaurant and invest in merchandise for her business. Her dream is to see her business grow each day, and to become a successful businesswoman. Laura would like to thank the Cooperativa San Jose for their support with the loans, so that her group can improve their businesses and accomplish their dreams of having their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to expand her restaurant and invest in merchandise for her business

loans.name: Benkadi Vi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI VI  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Sokan de la préfecture de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans, au moins 6 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
FANTA N. compte utiliser son pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, exclusivement  au grand marché de Kimparana ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de M’Pèrèsso et  dans les  marchés  environnants en détail (souvent en gros) au comptant à une clientèle composé de revendeurs.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI VI comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 20 000 à 25 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi VI group is composed of married women from the village of Sokan in the San prefecture, in the Segou Region (the fourth administrative region of Mali). The women live in traditional families. They are on the average 32 years old, have at least six children, and cultivate peanuts. In order to make their agricultural work profitable, three years ago they have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program. After having duly repaid previous loans, they are now on their third agricultural loan. Fanta N. plans to use her loan to purchase an ample supply of peanut seeds, small tools and agricultural inputs, at the big market in the town of Kimparana. After the winter season, the harvest is stored for a while as its price increases, before being sold at the big market of M’Pèrèsso and other nearby markets, retail (often wholesale) for cash to a customer base composed of resellers. After selling their produce, members of the Benkadi VI group plan to obtain an income, between 20,000 and 25,000 West African francs each, which will be used to pay off the loan interest and cover ongoing family expenses.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing agricultural inputs, seeds and small tools

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed K. is a 23-year-old businessman. He is single but has a longtime girlfriend whom he intends to marry very soon. He lives with his mother and some other relatives who are his dependents.

For the past five years, Ahmed has been trading in menswear to help him generate enough income to support his dependents. His business is located in the central market of Bo city. He makes a lot of sales because his business is located in the city center.

Ahmed has a very good loan repayment history. He needs a loan of Le 3,000,000 to buy more bales of menswear to sell. He intends to use the proceeds from this loan to provide livelihood for his family and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more men's clothes to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter B. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. He is 56 years old. Peter is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Peter owns and operates a service-based business venture. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing mechanical services, "motor repair," to local community members. Peter has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Peter joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Peter has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Peter is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Peter from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Mrs. Keo Nhor Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fourteen people located in Kampong Luong village in Takeo province. Mrs. Keo N., who was born in1957, is the village bank president having been selected by the other members. Each member will use their portion of the loan for their different purpose.

Mrs. Keo N. and her husband, Mr. Kun Chea, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. Mrs. Keo N. is also a Khmer cake seller. She has a problE. because it is time to grow rice but she does not have rice seed. So, to improve matters, she is applying for a loan to buy rice seed.

Mrs. Keo N. is the mother of five children, one of whom is a soldier, another is employed in a casino club, another is a farmer, and the others are attending school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed for her farm

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Doña Rosa tiene 58 años de edad vive junto a su esposo en el Departamento de San Miguel, ella se dedica a la venta de Ropa comercializándola  en el mercado municipal del municipio de Jucuapa desde hace 21 años con un horario de ocho de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde; Ella quiere crecer con su negocio y por el momento no cuenta con los fondos necesarios para realizar la inversión por lo que doña Rosa está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mas mercadería como blusas, faldas, camisas y ropa interior, ya que son prendas demandadas por sus clientes.
Este préstamo ayudará que ella crezca con el negocio, aumenten sus ventas y ofrezca mejores y más prendas de vestir a sus clientes.
El sueño de doña Rosa es aumentar su negocio, generar los ingresos necesarios para el sustento diario de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 58 years old and she lives with her husband in the San Miguel department. For 21 years she has been selling clothes in the municipal market of the town of Jucuapa: she works form 8 am to 4 pm. She wants her activity to grow but right now she does not have enough money to invest and for this reason Rosa is requesting a loan: she will use it to buy more products such as blouses, skirts, shirts and lingerie, the kind of products her customers ask for. Through the loan her activity will grow, her sales will increase and she will be able to offer her customers a wider selection of clothes of better quality. Rosa dreams of improving her activity and of earning the necessary income to provide for the daily necessities of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita B. is 48 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. She is from the village of Namnama in the barangay of Magsaysay, a part of the municipality of Saguday, Quirino province on the islands of Luzon. Lolita operates a tailoring business from which she provides general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 29 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2006 Lolita joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Lolita successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional fabric and materials. Lolita is requesting a new loan, her eighth from ASKI, of 20,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional fabric and materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabric and materials

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en: Here is Amadu B., a micro entrepreneur from Kabala, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This 25-year-old husband is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 leones for the first time from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to expand his business. He sells assorted goods – cottons, jeans, shirts, shoes, bed sheets, briefcases, etc. Amadu usually travels to neighboring Guinea to buy the goods he sells. With the help of this Kiva loan, Amadu will be able to expand his business by buying stock wholesale. Consequently, his business will improve both in size and quality and, eventually, Amadu will be able to overcome his current greatest challenge which is to have a shop or store to accommodate more goods. Currently, he sells his goods in a stall at the market.

loans.use: To buy cottons, jeans, shirts, shoes, bed sheets, briefcases, etc., in large quantity

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a very hardworking married man, aged 22 who is living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His greatest desire is to have his children go to school and to increase his daily savings at home. He is a motorcyclist and has been in the transport sector for the last seven years. Wilson is faced with a challenge of remitting 70% of the daily income to the motorcycle owner, thus leading to limited income and savings for him. He says that he has finally found a solution to income issues by getting himself a motorcycle and thus the need for credit. He intends to purchase a motorcycle for his transport business with the loan.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Rueben Shihundu

texts.en:
Rueben has operated in the motorcycle transport business in Naivasha town for the last two years.  He is 32 years old and married to Elizabeth Auma.  They have two children.

Rueben was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend.  He is applying for a second loan of KES 30,000.  He plans to use the loan to renew his PSV license, service his motorbike and get new reflectors. He paid off his first loan well and in good time.  

Rueben hopes to buy his own taxi in future.

loans.use: To renew his license and service his motorbike

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent bills.

She has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Norah faces a major challenge of theft in her business. She hopes to build her own home in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sodas and packets of sweets for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sodas and packets of sweets for sale

loans.name: Laura Del Pilar

texts.es:
Laura Del Pilar C. M. tiene 21 años de edad, Vive en unión Libre vive con el compañero  y  con los hijos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNION SAN ANTONIO, Recinto San Antonio parroquia San José del Tambo distancia de la oficina a 150 minutos de la comunidad se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Laura Del Pilar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder comprar una casa.

Le gusta disfrutar de las fiestas del Recinto.
texts.en:
Laura Del Pilar C. M. is 21 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  She has 2 children.

The members of the UNION SAN ANTONIO community bank are located in San Antonio precinct, in San José del Tambo parish, 150 minutes from our office, in Chillanes canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  They have been in this business for a long time.

Laura Del Pilar is a farmer.  She grows corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  She buys her products in the Matilde Ester shopping area and sells her products in Bucay.

Laura Del Pilar is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for growing corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to be able to buy a house.  She enjoys taking part in local fiestas.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam A. is from the village of P.5 Lower Loboc, Oroquieta City. She is 51 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Meriam owns and operates a fishing business, selling seafood such as fish and shrimp in the local community. Meriam has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Meriam joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. Meriam is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Kantutitas De San Simon Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Kantutitas de San Simón” iniciará su  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana,  se han reunido para solicitar crédito y recibir servicios en salud y capacitación.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes.  Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados:  Venta de Tejas,  taller para elaborar mochilas, taller de carpintería, artículos varios, venta de productos de limpieza, taller de tejidos, tejidos y taller de bordado.
La B.C. “Kantutitas de San Simón” está dirigida por una mesa directiva: la señora Flora es la presidenta, la señora Yolanda es la tesorera y la señora Celia es la secretaria de actas. 
La señora Flora, presidenta de la banca comunal, indica que  esta es su primera experiencia como socia de Pro Mujer.   Su negocio es la venta de “cachivaches”(nombre que le da a los productos pequeños que se utilizan en el hogar, como por ejemplo: pasta dental, ganchos de ropa, agujetas, cepillos de dientes y otros).  Lleva adelante este negocio desde hace dos años, las ventas son realizadas en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto los días martes y domingo. El crédito solicitado le dará la oportunidad a la señora Flora de aumentar su mercadería y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The “Kantutitas de San Simón” communal bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer. As part of the Panamericana Regional Hub, the group has met to apply for a loan and to receive training and health services. The group has nine members. They work in a variety of businesses: tile sales, a workshop for making backpacks, carpentry shop, various items, sales of cleaning products, knitting shop, knitted items and embroidery shop.

The “Kantutitas de San Simón” communal bank has a board of directors: Flora is the president, Yolanda is the treasurer and Celia is the recording secretary.

Flora, the communal bank's president, says this is her first experience as a Pro Mujer member. Her business is selling “cachivaches” (a name for the small items that are used around the home, such as toothpaste, clothes hangers, shoelaces, toothbrushes, etc.). She has had this business for two years, making her sales at the markets in El Alto on Tuesdays and Sundays. This loan will give Flora the chance to add to her merchandise and have better earnings.

loans.use: Purchase toothpaste, creams, clothes hangers, batteries

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael G. is the owner and manager of Ismael Trucking Service, Inc., a hauling and excavation business.  Ismael manages day-to-day operations of the business, with his wife handling business finances.  In addition to the two of them, there is also a part-time driver who helps when needed.  
Ismael describes his business as a “do-it-all” outfit because of its diverse clients and the wide array of services it provides.  The business originally began as a hauling service, and Ismael would set up contracts with companies or individuals that needed material removed from a site.  Ismael had one truck with which he did all the hauling, and he grew his business by word of mouth.  

A few years ago, Ismael was able to purchase a backhoe, expanding the work his business could do.  The backhoe lets him to dig ditches for electrical lines, clear away trees and brush, break up concrete and excavate for houses, just to name a few of its uses.  For the competive industry in which Ismael operates, possesing such capabilities makes his business more attractive to clients.

Ismael is using the money from this loan to meet pressing business expenses.  He does not take any upfront payment for work he does, because of the negative image it would portray to customers.  He believes it builds respectability for his business when he waits to collect payment until a job’s completion.  This loan will allow him to buy materials needed for jobs, as well as help him with meeting other pressing operational costs such as payroll.  Business has been slow over the past few months due to the economy and inclement winter weather (when it rains, work grinds to a halt until the ground dries).  All of this puts pressure on cash flow, and affects Ismael’s ability to take on new business.  Ismael says were it not for this loan, he would have had to sell some of his equipment.

Ismael and his wife have 5 children, the latest of which are 18 month old twin boys.  Despite all the work that comes with maintaining and growing a small business, Ismael and his wife make family a priority.  They enjoy helping the kids with their schoolwork, and encourage their children to be active in extracurricular activities.

loans.use: Materials for already undertaken projects, payroll and other operational expenses

loans.name: Luy

texts.en: Luy V., 41, resides with her family in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. V. sells vegetables, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 66 on food and USD 50 on other expenses. V. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more vegetables to expand her business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang T. T. N. is 35 years old and has two children who are in secondary school. She has been a farmer for many years. Her main activity focuses on growing flowers and clean vegetables. Everyday, she takes them to the center market to sell wholesale. In this way, she can have a stable income from this activity. 

Joining with our credit program in 2004, she has received seven loans year after year and used them very effectively in running her business. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy more fertilizer and some equipment to increase her product quality.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and some equipment

loans.name: Winny

texts.en: Winny is 20 years old, married, and has one child who does not go to school. Winny is currently in the business of selling bread. She is requesting a loan to stock more bread to sell. In the future, with her extra profits, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a farmer in the Litein area, South Rift, Kenya, and he has been doing mixed farming for ten years now. His farm produces maize, tea, milk, and vegetables, but mostly eggs which he sells to the local market. Nelson is married with seven children between the ages of 6 and 15, all schooling.

Nelson has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry birds for the business. He says the acquisition of additional birds will generate more income to help the family with their basic needs, like the education of the children. He is focusing on raising more birds and diversifying his poultry business from layers to broilers.

Nelson is glad Juhudi Kilimo offers agricultural loans.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 53 años, vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposo en su casa que es propia. Hace más D. 19 años que se dedica en la venta D. golosinas, en donD. tiene un stand móvil en la puerta D. un colegio, ahí los niños, quienes son sus clientes, siempre acuden para consumir algún producto o bebida gasificada. Su horario D. trabajo es durante el recreo, así como la salida D. los alumnos. Sus hijos le dan su apoyo, cando tiene que dejar el puesto para irse al mercado mayorista y adquirir más mercadería para implementar su negocio. Su deseo es mejorar su stand e implementar su puesto D. golosinas. Es su crédito número 13 con MFP, durante este tiempo con su grupo considera a cada uno D. sus integrantes sus amigas y con las que pueD. contar porque tiene confianza. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra D. más mercadería en dulces al por mayor.
texts.en: Luz is 53 years old and she lives with her 4 children and her husband in a house that is their own. She has been selling sweets for more than 19 years. She has a cart and she takes it to the door of the school where the children, her clients, always come looking for some snack or soft drink. Her work schedule is during recess time and when school is let out. Her children help her when she needs to leave the stand to go to the wholesale markets to acquire more merchandise for her business. Her wish is to improve her stand and to supply her sweets business. This is her 13th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and today she considers each one of the members to be her friends that she can depend on because they have her trust. This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise in wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase sweets in wholesale.

loans.name: Konstantin

texts.en:
Konstantin N. is a 43-year-old farmer. He comes from the village of Shroma, West Georgia. Konstantin is married and lives with his wife Melano, his parents and three daughters. His elder daughters Irina and Mariam are 14 and 13 years old and go to the local school. Little Linda is two years old and is at home with mom and dad. 

All adult members of the family are involved in the family agricultural activities. They have two milk cows. The dairy products from the cows are sold on the local market. In addition, they grow nuts, potatoes and tangerines and sell them locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris. 

Konstantin requested a loan for tilling the land and purchasing fertilizers. It will improve the harvest and thus the income of the family. In the future, Konstantin plans to reinvest the profit in development of the dairy farm by purchasing more milk cows and selling more dairy products.

loans.use: to pay for tilling the land and fertilizers

loans.name: Edna Arcelia

texts.es:
Edna Arcelia es socia del Banco Comunal “Uniòn Arco Deustua” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 63 años de edad, de estado civil separada, tiene cuatro hijos, todos independientes.  La señora  estudio educación secundaria. 
Hace más de ocho años que trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R.,  su primer préstamo solicitado de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles dinero lo invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas (restaurant, sanwicherias y dulcerías).  También nos cuenta que en sus ratos libres se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, negocio que también le genera ganancias.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, incrementará al capital de su negocio para comprar colonias joyas y perfumes, también cuenta que invertirá en la compre de insumos para la elaboración de alimentos para eventos.  
Su sueño es seguir con el negocio por que dice que es una distracción.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la unión y la puntualidad entre las socias..
texts.en:
Edna Arcelia is a member of the communal bank "Unión Arco Deustua" in the district, province and department of Puno.  She is 63 years old, separated and has four independent children.  She has a secondary education.

For eight years she has been working with the Manuela R. Movement.  She invested her first loan of 300 PEN in her food business (restaurant, sandwiches and sweets).  In her free time she also sells beauty products which generates extra income.

The new loan in the amount of 500 PEN will be used as business capital to buy colognes, jewelry and perfumes.  She also plans to buy supplies to prepare food for events.

Her dream is to continue with her business because it keeps her busy.  What she likes about the communal bank is the solidarity and punctuality of the members.

loans.use: To buy colognes, jewelry, perfumes, and supplies.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: Lorena, de 21 años, es una mujer un poco tímida pero trabajadora y hábil; ella vive con su mamá y su hermano Frank de 16 años, en una casa alquila ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad nativa Centro Pumpuriani). Como mujer soltera, Lorena piensa que lo más importante es pensar en su futuro y el de su familia, por ello desde hace 3 años, logró comprar un pequeño terreno donde siembra plátanos, maíz y café; que después los vende a los compradores que visitan los fines de semana la comunidad nativa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, trabajar la chacra y la ayuda incondicional de su hermano Frank; “eso me incentiva a salir adelante”, menciona. En este mes se encuentra muy ocupada, ya que deposita todo su esfuerzo en la cosecha de café que tiene. “Esta es la única temporada donde se pueda obtener ingresos”, afirma. En su hectárea de café y plátano está logrando adquirir buenos frutos y eso gracias a la fuerza que su juventud le otorga. Por ello está ahorrando para comprar más terrenos de cultivo y así sembrar mayor cantidad de café, a pesar de no contar con un capital de trabajo propio, pero está segura de poder hacer realidad su objetivo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Abejitas de Pumpuriani”, y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Lorena, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para sus cultivos de café que hace poco sembró.
texts.en:
Lorena, 21 years old, is a slightly timid but hard working and skilled woman. She lives with her mother and her brother Frank who is sixteen years old, in a rented house located in the Peruvian jungle (Centro Pumpuriani indigenous community). As a single woman, Lorena thinks that the most important thing is to think about her future and that of her family. This is why three years ago, she bought a small plot of land where she grows plantains, corn and coffee. She then sells it to buyers that visit the indigenous community on the weekends.

What she loves most about her job is planting, working the small farm, and the unconditional help she gets from her brother, Frank. “This is my incentive to come out ahead,” she mentions. She is very busy this month, since she put all of her energy into her coffee plot. “This is the only season that I can obtain inputs,” she declares. 

Her hectare of coffee and plantains has resulted in good fruit, thanks to her youthful strength. She is saving to buy more land so that she can grow more coffee, even though she does not count on income from a job. But she is sure that she can realize her goals.

She belongs to the “Abejitas de Pumpuriani” communal bank. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she hopes that the collaboration helps her to continue toward her goals. She commits once more to fulfilling her payments, as she has in her other loans. She is grateful to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are reasonable and supportive people. Upon receiving support, Lorena will invest the requested money into the purchase of various sacks of organic fertilizer for the coffee crops that she has recently grown.

loans.use: purchase several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Pruon

texts.en: Mrs. Pruon, 28 years old, is a chef in a rice shop in Siem Reap Province. She typically makes around $5 of profit each day to meet her family's needs. She is married to Mr. Chheim, 25, a motor taxi driver. They have been married for awhile but they have no children yet. Mrs. Pruon currently lives with her mother-in-law, who is a pig breeder. Mrs. Pruon will be using these funds to purchase some piglets.

loans.use: to purchase some piglets

loans.name: Maryuri Mariuxi

texts.es:
Maryuri Mariuxi tiene 21 años, es soltera vive con su hijo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo Josué de 2 años.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Voluntad de Dios en el Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra maíz y arroz.


Maryuri se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Peña y vende sus productos en el mercado mayorista de ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para mejorar su producción  y suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es comprar una moto para desarrollar su actividad economía. Enfrenta el desafío de la sequia.

Le gusta predicar la palabra de Dios.
texts.en:
Maryuri Mariuxi is 21 years old, single and living with her son in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.   She has a two-year-old son, Josué.

The members of the “Valle Alto” (High Valley) communal bank are located in Voluntad de Dios, Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn and rice farming activities.

Maryuri is a corn and rice farmer.  She buys her supplies at Comercial Peña and her sales take place at the Ventanas wholesale market.

She is requesting the loan for her corn and rice crops; she will buy farming supplies and fertilizers for them.  Support from the loan will help her economically to improve production and meet her needs.  Her dream is to buy a motorcycle to carry out her economic activity.  The challenge she faces is the drought.

She enjoys preaching the word of God.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for the crops.

loans.name: Simiyu

texts.en:
Simiyu is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya.  She has been growing maize and beans for the last year.  She is married, with one child under 2 years old.  She runs a boutique for additional income.

Simiyu has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the new dairy cow will boost the family farming income and livelihood. She remains optimistic she will be able to own three quality dairy cows.

 She is concerned about unpredictable market conditions but has faith in Juhudi's loan services

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en:
Maruf is an active and hard-working man. He is married and the father of three children. Maruf always tries to improve his living conditions and that’s why he engages in  drying fruit. He has been in this business for 14 years and he has a good business experience. With the profit which he made from this business he bought the house and currently he lives with his family there. 

Maruf would like to a loan of 1200 USD for purchasing dried fruits in order to expand his business and improve his living conditions. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy dried fruits.

loans.name: Juan Rene

texts.es: Don René tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, es padre de cuatro hijos, pero solo tres de ellos se dedican a estudiar, y el cuarto de sus hijos perdió la vida. Don René tiene un negocio de Fotocopiado y tambien vende ropa interior para hombres y mujeres. Su negocio no tiene nombre y trabaja de forma individual. El oficio lo aprendió observando el centro de fotocopiado de la Escuela Primaria donde tambien trabaja como Maestro de Educacion. Por las mañanas por mientras él da clases en la escuela su esposa le ayuda a atender el negocio y por la tarde lo hace él. Sus metas son criar a sus hijos de manera tal que sean personas productivas y honestas, y para su negocio desea que crezca e ir lo convirtiendo en un ciber cafe para que este le genere mas ganancias y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor vida economica. El prestamo que solicita lo necesita para comprar toner para la fotocopiadora, papel tamaño carta, oficio y legal, asi como lapices, folders, entre otros. Con el apoyo del prestamo podra mantener activo su negocio y eso significa una fuente extra de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Algunos de sus desafios son que vive en una zona rural y debe vender sus productos a un costo muy bajo y que tiene bastante competencia. Este es el segundo prestamo de Don René en FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en: Don Rene is 41 years old, is married and his wife is in charge of taking care of their home.  He is father to four children, only three of them are going to school, the fourth lost his life.  Don Rene has a business making copies and also sells underwear for men and women.  His business does not have a name and he works by himself.  He learned the trade while observing the photocopy center of the elementary school where he also works as a teacher.  In the mornings, while he is teaching at the school his wife takes care of the business, and in the afternoons he takes it over.  His goals are to raise his children in a way that they become productive and honest individuals, and to continue growing his business and eventually convert it to a cybercafe, this way increasing his income and being able to give his family a better life.  The loan that he is requesting is for buying toner for his photocopy machines, letter and legal sized paper, pencils, folder and other such items.  With the support from the loan, he will be able to continue his business which provides an additional source of income for the support of his family.  Some of his challenges are that he lives in a rural area and his products sell a lower prices and also that he has a fair amount of competition.  This is the second loan for Don Rene with FAMA and he has paid his installments on time.

loans.use: Purchase toner and paper.

location.town: San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is an active business woman aged 32 years. She is married and blessed with two children who are in school. For the last 8 years she has been vending water in order to meet the needs of her family. She makes an extra shilling from the rent she collects from her rental houses. In the next 5 years, she wants to enlarge her business and penetrate into other regions. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a water tank. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she can now access credit facilities easily.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with five children, two boys and three girls. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and clothing.

Jane has operated a food-stall business for more than ten years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Competition is a major business challenge for her. She dreams of building real estate houses in the future.

With a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she plans to purchase iron sheets to roof her house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets to roof her house.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is married with one son.  For over eight years she has run a sari-sari store (small store).  Gilda has worked with much effort and dedication. 

The profits from her business have been favorable and allowed her to keep her store running.

Gilda is requesting a loan to buy products such as cooking oil, soft drinks, bread, soups, cookies, coffee and sodas.  

Her dream is to expand her business and keep it active.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, snack foods, spices and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr:
Cliente de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie 8 et 24 ans, coiffeuse depuis bientôt 20 ans, elle se débrouillait tant bien que mal, et quand elle reçoit le premier de Hope, son activité prend de la vitesse, elle a rembourse ses prêts avec succès et a des épargnes considérables. 
Ses revenus sont de 40000 fr a 130000 fr par jour, elle a également des filles mères qui apprennent  le métier de la coiffure auprès d'elle.
Avec ce quatrième prêt , elle va acheter des produits comme 10 kg de démêlants, 10 kg de defrisants, des lots de pinces, lots des peignes tiges, des mèches et tissages.
Elle  a aussi acheter une tonne de ciment, et 10 tôles d'aluminium  pour avancer la construction de son salon de coiffure.
Tres enthousiaste , elle tient a aller jusqu'au bout pour qu'elle puisse se faire un nom dans le monde de la coiffure.
texts.en:
Pierette, age 44, is married and the mother of three children, age 8 to 24. For nearly 20 years, she's been a hairdresser. She managed to run her business as best one can and, when she received her first loan from Kiva's partner, Hope, her business soared.

She successfully repaid her previous loans and was able to put quite a large amount of money away. Her daily revenue amounts to XOF 40'000 to 130'000 (ca US$ 60 to 200). She also trains several girl mothers who learn hairdressing with her.

With her fourth loan, she will buy 10 kg of detangling product, 10 kg of hair straightening product, bundles of hair grips, tail combs, hair extensions, and weaves.

She also bought one ton of cement and ten aluminum sheets to progress with building her hair salon. Very enthusiastic, she has at heart to follow through in order to make a name for herself in the hairdressing world.

loans.use: to buy detangling product, hair straightening product, hair grips, tail combs, hair extensions, and weaves.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  lives in  Uganda, is married and has 7 children, six of whom are in school. 

Sarah sells clothes and has been in business for over 10 years.  She works 6 days out of every week. 

Sarah has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. 

Her main business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals are to start selling on wholesale basis only and to build rental rooms. 

Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
