This is Hilda, who is 30 and a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Grille, and is a mother to their two children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support her children’s schooling. 

Hilda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to his house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippines pesos (Php)  in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 34,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Hilda hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sania Yaset

texts.es:
Sania tiene 27 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y su hijo.
Ella tiene seis años de dedicarse a la venta de productos por catálogo.

Un día de trabajo para Sania,involucra salir a repartir catálogos, hacer nuevos clientes, entregar pedidos. Ella da un plazo de 15 días a sus clientes para el pago de los productos.Organizando el cobro cuatro días antes del vencimiento de sus facturas.

Es la primera vez que Sania solicita un crédito a una institución financiera,siempre ha trabajado con el crédito de sus proveedores y sus ahorros.

Ella ha solicitado un préstamo a Fundación Mujer, para aprovechar la temporada y vender mayores cantidades.
Con el préstamo ella comprará : zapatos, ropa de cama, ropa interior y artículos para el hogar.

En un futuro Sania espera tener estabilidad económica,para brindarle a su familia mejores comdiciones  de vida.
texts.en:
Sania is 27, married, and lives with her husband and son.
She has sold clothing through a catalogue for six years.

A typical workday for Sonia involves going out to distribute catalogues, find new clients, and deliver orders. She allows her clients a period of fifteen days to pay for the products, and she makes sure that this deadline occurs four days before she is billed.

This is the first time that Sania has requested a loan from a financial institution. She has always worked with credit from her suppliers and from her own savings.

She has requested a loan from Fundacion Mujer in order to take advantage of the season and sell in greater quantities.

With this loan, she will purchase: shoes, bedding, underwear, and home items.

For the future, Sania hopes to enjoy economic stability in order to offer her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy products, such as clothing, shoes, and home items, from a catalogue for re-sale.

loans.name: Ines Milagros

texts.es: La socia actualmente se dedica  al elaboracion D. mazamoras y las prepara junto con el arroz con leche, ella prepara sus deliciosos postres y los lleva  avender en su carrito D. postres D. forma ambulatoria, la socia camina con su carrito vendiendo los diversos postres por la universidad, el hospital D. seguro y el hospital regional, la socia elabora los postres en casa y los lleva a vender, la socia tambien se dedica  apreparar desayunos por las mañanas en su casa porque tiene un club D. herbalife y son productos D. salud y ella prepara y venD. estos productos en casa. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra D. ingredientes para la elaboracion D. los postres y para invertir en la compra D. productos D. herbalife.
texts.en:
The borrower currently dedicates her time to making mazamoras, a type of dessert maD. with rice and milk. She prepares these delicious sweets and takes them to sell from her cart. She walks around with the cart, selling the sweets around the university and the two hospitals. She makes them at home and takes them out to sell. 

She also prepares breakfasts in her home, because she runs a "Herbalife" club. Herbalife is a range of health products, which she prepares and sells fromhome. She is seeking a loan to invest in buying more ingredients for making her desserts and in buying Herbalife products.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making desserts, and to invest in Herbalife products

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is married with 3 children. She is now 52 years old, and lives in Locuaban, Dumalinao, Zambaonga del Sur.

Sauda has a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month she earns approximately 15,000 PHP of doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Sauda has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. 

In the future, Sauda hopes to have a mini-grocery store in the area.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her brother and sister). 

Hadjah has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for eight years, and she works seven days out of every week. Hadjah sells her products from home, retail. Hadjah has requested for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through a rental room. 

The main business challenges for Hadjah include transportation, defaulters and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell wholesale, to own a delivery van to ease transportation, and to educate her children up to university.   Hadjah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Gina Susana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gina, ella tiene  44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 14 y de 11 años de edad que estudian en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella se dedica a la pesca y venta de pescado, tiene dos lanchas las cuales son tripuladas por dos o tres personas que ganan un buen porcentaje por la pesca que logren hacer,  estas personas se van a alta mar y se desplazan a la par de un barco pesquero el mismo que es tripulado por su esposo, ellos entregan el pescado en este barco y reciben el pago por el mismo, se van por 20 a 25 días seguidos y después de este tiempo regresan  a sus hogares para luego de una semana de descanso volver a alta mar. Ella tiene sus lanchas ya por 9 años y le va muy bien. 

Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, anzuelos, grapas, combustibles y alimentos, elementos indispensables para obtener una buena pesca. Lleva 9 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le han ayudado. 

Su sueño es comprar un barco más grande.
texts.en:
The Honduras 2000 communal bank meets in the Jaramijo (Manta) canton every two weeks.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches that bathe the coasts of this lovely place.  Most of the inhabitants here are very hard-working and devoted to sea related work.

This is the place where we meet Gina, age 44.  She is married and has two children, ages 14 and 11.  The children go to school.  Her husband is a fisherman.  She devotes herself to fishing and selling fish.

She has two boats that are manned by two or three people who earn a good percentage of the fish they catch.  These people go to the high sea and move level with the fishing boat that her husband mans.  They deliver the fish to this boat and receive their pay for the fish.

They go for 20 to 25 days in a row.  After that time, they return to their homes for a week of rest before returning to the open sea.  She has had her boats for nine years, and it is going very well for her.

She will use this loan to buy nets, cords, hooks, clamps, fuel, and food.  These are indispensable in order to get a good catch.  

She has been in her communal bank for nine years.  She likes it because the loans have always helped her.

Her dream is to buy a bigger boat.

loans.use: to buy nets, cords, hooks, clamps, fuel, and food.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Jitegemezi Ukata Group

texts.en:
Filomon is 58 years old and a father of nine children. He has been growing maize, beans, and coffee for over three years. Crop diseases and lack of fertilizers are problems for his farm.

Filomon spends much time looking for financial assistance to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. Also, he has a vision to strengthen his farming activities from 6 acres to 14 acres in the next five years. He expects to earn more income from this growth, which he can use to build a good house, buy a private transport facility, purchase clothes, and cover the medical expenses for his family.

loans.use: To purchase insecticide and fertilizer

loans.name: Amy Cole's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois nouvellement  inauguré ce 12 septembre 2013, est composé de  femmes qui ont eu à mener des activités génératrice de revenus avant d’intégrer le programme de bancs villageois dans l’objectif d’accroître leur capacité de financement. Elles vivent toutes dans le même quartier depuis plusieurs années et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide mutuel. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce. 

Madame Aissatou (debout à droite en tunique vert avec la main gauche  levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 35 ans, est mariée et mère de trois de filles de 02 à 08 ans. Son activité s’articule dans la vente de produits de cosmétiques et divers articles de beauté qu’elle achète soit dans la sous région et à la capitale pour revente dans sa localité à crédit ou au comptant selon sa relation avec la cliente. 

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte renforcer sa capacité de financement en achetant 02 douzaines de lait de corps, une de shampoing et parfum par envoi.

 Les bénéfices obtenus lui permettront de participer d’avantage dans la gestion quotidienne des charges de la famille.
texts.en:
This banc villageois was recently inaugurated on 12 September 2013. It is made up of women who managed businesses and then decided to start a banc villageois program in order to expand their financial capacity.

They all have been living in the same area for several years and maintain relations of solidarity and mutual aid. They all engage in small-scale commerce.

Aissatou (standing on the right in the green dress with her left hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 35 years old, married, and a mother of three girls, who are from two to eight years old. 

She sells cosmetics and beauty products which she buys in the subregion and the capital and then resells in her area for credit or cash according to how she knows her customers. With this new loan, she plans to increase her financial capacity to buy two dozen [bottles] of lotion, shampoo, and perfume per shipment. 

Earnings will allow her to participate in the management of her family's everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy two dozen bottles of lotion, shampoo, and perfume

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AZUCENAS” iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Milka es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de salchipapas, venta de tucumanas, venta de frutas, venta de comida, venta de leche, venta de cerveza, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Milka es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace ocho años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra  papa y arroz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la población de Achacachi para posteriormente, a la elaboración, comercializarlo en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan la capacitación y los ahorros que brinda la institución.

En la foto solo aparecen nueve integrantes porque la señora Esperanza, después del desembolso, se fue a su  puesto de venta.
texts.en:
The “AZUCENAS” communal bank group will begin its tenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Achacachi. It is made up of ten members and is led by a group of officers of which Milka is the treasurer. The businesses which the members of the communal bank carry would are varied and among them are selling sausages with fries, selling tucumanas [fried empanadas], selling fruit, selling food, selling milk, selling beer and a neighborhood store. 

The loan that they are getting will benefit the small business owners of which Milka is one. She says that five years ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a staff person from the institution. Currently, she has a business selling food. She indicates that she learned this business through her own initiative eight years ago. 

The loan she is now getting is to expand her capital (purchase potatoes and rice in bulk) which she will get from the wholesalers from Achacachi to later make and sell it in her sales location. This type of work allow her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is in a common-law marriage and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and savings that the institution offers. 

In the photo, there are only nine members because Esperanza, after the payments when to her sales stand.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a very young woman, she is 22 years old; she has two beautiful children with 3 and 1 year old respectively. Her concern is that they have a house, meals and an opportunity to study and to get ready for the future life. For this reason Maribel began her own business since 5 years ago. It consists in the food sales; she wants to give to her children a home where they can be developed because at the present time her family live in the husband’s mother house.

Maribel requires a loan of $200 USD to purchase inputs to the elaboration of her delicious meals. She hopes the next Christmas season her sales will increased, for that reason she needs to be prepared to assist the increase of her clients. She and her family need your help and support. In a term of 3 months Maribel wants to return the loan.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Maribel es una mujer muy joven, tiene 22 años de edad y tiene dos hermosos hijos de 3 y 1 año respectivamente. Su preocupación es que sus pequeños no les falte casa, comida y una oportunidad para estudiar y prepararse. Por esta razón Maribel inicio su negocio desde hace 5 años y consiste en la venta de comidas. Ella desea dar a sus hijos un hogar donde puedan desarrollarse porque en la actualidad su familia viven en la casa de la mama de su esposo.

Maribel requiere de un préstamo de $200 USD para comprar insumos para la elaboración de sus deliciosas comidas. Ella espera que esta próxima temporada navideña sus ventas se incrementen, por lo que necesita estar preparada para atender el aumento de sus clientes. Ella y su familia necesitan tu ayuda y apoyo. En un término de 3 meses Maribel desea retornar el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase inputs to the elaboration of her delicious meals

loans.name: Mary Awah

texts.en:
Mary is divorced and mother of six children with only one child attending school. Bad memories of the problems she faced in a polygamous marriage and the difficulties she encountered when her husband abandoned her are the reasons for her determination to make a go of life. She has a vision of building a house for herself and her children. With her two previous loans, she succeeded in providing her community with palm oil two days a week.

Given a loan of $500, she plans to increase her stock by buying tins of palm oil that could meet the demand in her neighborhood (at least four days a week). She also plans to buy and retail “country-nyama-njama” (a dish of green vegetables which is widely eaten), and chickens to raise for Christmas.

She plans to repay her loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.

loans.use: Selling palm oil and vegetables and raising chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to purchase seedlings, planting seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sandra Alina

texts.en:
Sandra C. lives in Ayacucho, Peru, with her husband and two children. Since 2001, she has operated a small business selling cosmetic products from her home. Five years ago, Sandra was given a small loan of US $50 by FINCA Peru, which she used to expand her product line and grow her business. She paid the loan back $5 per week, using a portion of the profits from her business. Sandra now is able to sell a wide variety of beauty products, such as hand cream and shampoo, to her friends and neighbors.

Sandra is thankful to her Village Bank not just for the seed money to grow her business, but also for the savings program that has enabled her to put money away for the education of her children, as well as plan for future uncertainties. Sandra very much looks forward to her weekly banking meetings. She says that the “reuniones” are not only a time to manage her finances, but also considers them a form of therapy, in that she has the opportunity to socialize with friends and talk about their lives.

When Sandra receives her next loan, she plans to use the money to further expand her product line, and well as purchase a small amount of back-up inventory of her most popular products in the event she sells out.

loans.use: Sandra plans to use the money to further expand her product line, and well as purchase a small amount of back-up inventory of her most popular products in the event she sells out.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is 50 years old and is single. She has to look after herself, and so 4 years ago she decided to start her own business selling food. She already knew how to make good seasoning and this has helped her business to succeed and grow. She lives off her business and would like it to grow and become more stable so that she can serve her clients better.

Juana would like a loan of $750 which she will repay in 4 months. She will use it to buy raw ingredients and to increase her sales so that she can have her own mexican diner. She thanks you for your support as this is what will make her business succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Juana es una mujer soltera de 50 años de edad, ella tiene que ver por su mantenimiento ya que no tiene quien la ayude, hace 4 años atrás ella decidió poner su negocio de comidas ya que es lo que ella sabe hacer y tiene buena sazón para sus comidas, por lo que esto la a ayudado al éxito de su negocio y a crecer con el poco a poco, con su negocio ella puede tener ingresos para su manutención, pero también desea crecer y poder tener un establecimiento fijo y en buen estado para sus comidas y mejorar el trato a sus clientes.

Juana está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 750, que ofrece pagarlo en 6 meses, con el cual invertirá en materia prima e incrementar sus ventas y así poder crecer y llegar a tener su local propio de comidas mexicanas, te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das ya que ella dice que con este apoyo y con sus ganas de trabajar podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy raw materials/Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Nancy Elizabeth

texts.en:
Nancy is full of energy despite working from 9:00 in the morning until 9:00 at night, seven days a week. For four years Nancy has owned two laundromats in her neighborhood in Lima. She has two employees that run one of the ‘lavanderías’, and she alone works at the other one.

Nancy’s husband is in the military and in addition to both working full time, they are busy raising their two young children, ages seven and eight. Nancy’s goal with this loan is to purchase another washing machine so she can increase business in her laundromat so she can better provide for her family.

loans.use: purchase another washing machine so she can increase business in her laundromat

loans.name: Blasina

texts.en:
Blasina is forty-five years old and has four children, three of them boys. The three elder ones work and the youngest attends school. Blasina has been separated from her husband for seven months.

With the first loan she obtained from FSMA, Blasina invested in the purchase of raw materials and some new cooking pots and an old oven so that she could keep on operating her small sandwich and hamburger business. Now her business is very profitable and she has managed to attract a lot of loyal customers.

This entrepreneur now wants to enlarge her business further. She has requested a second loan to buy ingredients to continue preparing sandwiches and to offer new sorts in order to attract new clients and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to continue producing sandwiches, etc.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
For six years, Sonia has earned a living selling cosmetics and a few cold drinks at the Israel Lewites market in Managua. A mother of 3 children, for whom she has to provide an education, she's a strong and hard-working woman. She's invested in her business in order to improve her economic situation which, by all accounts, has been difficult because she's the only income earner for the household.

Before she had this business, Sonia worked as an assistant in a mill, but she didn't earn much and she decided to save so that she could start her own business selling cosmetics. Now, thanks to loans granted by Ceprodel (3 loans), she has seen ever bigger sales of her cosmetics and beverages. Furthermore, she's managed to buy a display case for showing her products and providing better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace seis años, en el mercado Israel Lewites en la ciudad de Managua, la señora Sonia C. se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y algunas bebidas como sodas. Por ser madre de 3 hijos a los que tiene que brindarles educación, ha sido una dama muy esforzada y trabajadora la cual ha invertido en su negocio para el mejoramiento de su situación económica la cual según cuenta ha estado muy difícil por el hecho de que ella es el único sostén en el hogar.

Antes de tener este negocio se dedicaba al trabajo de ayudante en un molino el cual no le generaba buenos ingresos por lo que decide ahorrar para poder implementar su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos y hoy en día, por medio de Créditos realizados en Ceprodel (3 créditos ) ha realizado mayores volúmenes de compra de cosméticos y bebidas. Además ha logrado comprar una vitrina para colocar sus productos y brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Nangwe Madibira (Vii) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Hadijah M.. She sells new clothes and is requesting a loan to increase her stock. Hadijah is 27 years old and married. Her husband is a clearing agent. She has 4 children ranging in age from 10 months to 5 years. Three of them go to school. Each week, Hadijah makes approximately UGX 80000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to complete construction of her new house. Hadijah received a loan from BRAC Uganda previously in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to invest in her business, and the loan was paid back on time.

Hadijah is joined in her small group by Jenifer N., Hafuwa M. and Harriet K.. Jenifer N. has a business in clothing sales and wants to expand her business. Hafuwa M. sells second-hand clothes and wants a loan to expand the business. Harriet K. also operates a business in used clothes and wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand clothing business

loans.name: Kiyinki B1 South D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Amina M.. She is currently in the business of selling paraffin and is requesting a loan to add more capital. Amina is 33 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 6 to 14 and her children go to school. Each week, Amina makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land.

Amina is joined in her small group by Lydia K., Rose N., Hadija N., and Hadijah E.. Lydia K. has a business in paraffin sales and wants to expand her business. Rose N. is currently operating a business selling shoes and clothes and wants a loan to add more to her shoe business. Hadija N. operates a public pay phone business and wants to purchase more credit cards and another phone. Hadijah E. is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to increase stock.

loans.use: To stock and reserve large volumes of paraffin

loans.name: Olasukunmin

texts.en: Olasukunmin O. is a mother of 7, 45 years of age and hails from Okoko, Lagos State,Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs and has been in this business since 1994. She needs the sum of $450 to enable her to buy more foodstuffs to increase her stock and to maximize profit.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.en:
Rosendo A. C. has a cheese-making business in the town of Carabamba high in the Sierras of La Libertad Region. She makes the cheeses during the week and then travels to the city of Trujillo to sell her product. She has over 20 years of experience. Her slogan is “Better for Less” and she has many loyal customers.

A. is 61 years old, married, and has 7 children. Family is very important to her and she is happy she has a business to help support her children and grandchildren. A. is in wonderful health and looks forward to growing her business.

A member of the community bank Alfa y Omega, A. is requesting a loan of s/1300 to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to buy ingredients to make more cheese.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy ingredients to make more cheese.

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.en: Fidelia N. is 45 years old and married with 4 children. Fidelia sells fairly used clothes in the market. She lives in Alaba, Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for the past 3 years. She needs a loan of $1,200 to buy more fairly used clothes in bulk in order to meet the demands of her customers. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more fairly used clothes for sale

loans.name: Lebene

texts.fr:
Lebene K. is 33 years old, married, and the father of 2 school-attending children. He lives in Assahoun, a village located approximately 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He would like to use this loan to perform repairs on his car and to refurbish his motor, which is worn from use. This will enable to spend less on the repairs and to save more money in order to meet his family's needs.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Lebene K. est âgé de 33 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants tous à l'école. il réside à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale toglaise. Il désire par ce crédit procéder au renouvellement du moteur qui est usé et aussi à la révision de sa voiture. Ce qui lui permettra de dépenser moins pour la réparation et de mieux économiser afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is divorced and is raising her son, Edward, alone. She is a new entrepreneur from Kahovka, Ukraine, where she runs her women's clothing business in the local city market. Valentina started her business because need forced her to support her family and find ways to provide for her son and herself. She is only a beginner in business, since she launched her venture only 7 months ago. Her turnover capital is about $2000. Net profit is about $700 each month.

Valentina is a determined entrepreneur. She knows how to set goals and achieve them. Today, she is requesting a loan for 2500 Grivnas ($550 USD) to generate additional profit which will allow her to feel more financially secure. She believes that financial assistance in combination with her zeal, perseverance, and diligent work will someday help all her entrepreneurial dreams come true. 

Note: This is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To generate additional profit

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 28 years old. She is married with twin children aged 7 months. She has owned and run her own shop since 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Riziki is now requesting a loan to buy more commodities for her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business

loans.name: Adalat

texts.en: Adalat is 28 years old, is married, and has one child. He lives in Baku City. He has been in business of selling office supplies for five years. He would like a loan of $625 to buy increased office supplies to help improve the output of his business.

loans.use: to buy the office supplies

loans.name: Thi Hien's Group

texts.vi:
Vũ Thị Hiến, sinh năm 1971 (Ms 23060006), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Là một giáo viên nhưng chị vẫn tăng ra sản xuất cùng chồng. Ngoài công việc giảng dậy, chị vẫn chịu khó chăn nuôi thêm lợn để tăng thu nhập và nuôi hai con còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.500.000 vnđ/ tháng. Cùng vay vốn với chị còn có:
Đào Thị Mai, sinh năm 1966 (Ms 23060007), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Chị là giáo viên thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.500.000 vnđ / tháng.
Lê Thị Liên, sinh năm 1964(Ms 23060009), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn, gà.
Đào Thị Lý, sinh năm 1977(Ms 23060011), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng cơ khí.
Nguyễn Thị Thảo, sinh năm 1980(Ms 23060033), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 2.204.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn.
texts.en:
Mrs. V. Thi Hien (ID Number 23060006), born in 1971, would like to borrow 4,452,000VND to invest in rearing pigs. Even though she is a teacher, she still performs agricultural tasks with her husband. Besides teaching in school, she rears pigs to increase her family's income and raise her two children who are still going to school. He family's average monthly income is about 3,500,000VND (about 219USD). Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. D. Thi Mai (ID Number 23060007), born in 1966, borrows 4,452,000VND to invest in raising livestock. She is also a teacher. Her family's average monthly income is about 2,500,000VND (about 156USD).
  • Mrs. L. Thi Lien (ID Number 23060009), born in 1964, borrows 4,452,000VND to invest in rearing pigs and chickens.
  • Mrs. D. Thi Ly (ID Number 23060011), born in 1977, borrows 4,028,000VND to sell electrical goods.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thao (ID Number 23060033), born in 1980, borrows 2,204,000VND to invest in rearing pigs.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rearing pigs

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 43-year-old man who lives in Saida (in southern Lebanon) with his wife and their four children. For many years now, Mohamed has been in the business of selling fruits and vegetables. Mohamed is known for the high quality of his vegetables and fruits, and also for his tireless work ethic. Indeed, despite the fact that there are many vegetable/fruit sellers in his area, he has separated himself from the pack and has done very well with his business. 

He is now requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 via A. Majmoua in order to purchase some olives and herbs. This is the fourth loan cycle for Mohamed in his micro-finance endeavors. In the future, he plans to purchase a pickup truck for his work.

loans.use: To expand his inventory by purchasing olives and herbs

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan N., 29, is a widow and sells sugarcane juice from her house to earn a living. She is able to make $8 US a day. She lives with one young child and her old father in Kampong Cham Province.

She would like to take out a loan of $700 US to purchase sugarcane and open a grocery store for additional profit.

loans.use: To purchase sugar cane and open a grocery store.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Esther B. from Mwanza. She is separated from her husband and has two children, 12 and 16 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because that child's parents do not take care of her.

Esther B. has been running a cloth business since 2008. The client’s business is doing well. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, and is assisted by one employee. Esther B. currently earns about US$ 200 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 in order to purchase more cloth. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Esther thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth for re-sale

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sorn L., 51, and his wife, Mrs. Yat Cheng, 48, who live in a small village in the suburbs of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, married in 1980 and have four children: one son and three daughters. One of their daughters is a tailor; another one has full-time employment, and two children are in school.

Sorn has been a driving a motor taxi for one year. He does his job in Phnom Penh and earns about US$ 2.50 a day. His wife has been a tailor for seven years and earns about US$ 3.75 per day.

Sorn is requesting his first a loan of US$ 600 to purchase a motorbike for his children to ride to school. Part of the loan will be used to buy a sewing machine for his daughter’s business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to school and buy a sewing machine for his daughter’s business.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe  Sabougnouman (une veuve et 3 femmes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 4 enfants, vivent  dans des familles monogamiques dans le quartier Ségou Coura de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et dans  une association traditionnelle. 
Elles font essentiellement le commerce de condiments alimentaires et ont connu Soro Yiriwaso à travers l’assemblée générale tenue dans le vestibule du chef de quartier de Ségou Coura. Elles sont à leur 9ème prêt solidaire,  après avoir bien remboursé les huit prêts précédents. 
Ce prêt sera utilité pour acheter , 200kg de beurre de karité, 6 bassines de piment, 3 sacs d’aubergine, 200kg d’oignon frais dont une partie serait torréfiée et 2sacs  de graines d’arachide qui seront transformées en pâte. Elles se ravitaillent en condiments au grand marché de Ségou à la foire hebdomadaire. La vente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile, au marché de Ségou Coura et à l’extérieur du Mali (Sénégal, Burkina Faso et France pour le beurre de karité) à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel moyen de 49 160FCA qui sera  utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt et  l’achat du trousseau de mariage pour leurs filles. Leur objectif est d’avoir une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The women of the group Sabougnouman are composed of one widow and three married women who average 38 years of age and 4 children. They live in monogamous families in the Ségou Coura district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through marital and community ties and through a traditional association. Essentially they do commerce in condiments and found out about Soro Yiriwaso through the general assembly held in the reception area of the chief of the Ségou Coura district.

The group members are on their ninth solidarity loan, after having repaid the preceding eight loans. This loan will be used to buy: 200 kg of fresh onions, part of which would be roasted; and 2 sacks of peanuts, which will be made into peanut butter. They resupply themselves with these condiments at the grand marketplace of Ségou during the weekly fair. Sales are made at home, at the Ségou Coura marketplace, and outside of Mali (Sénégal, Burkina Faso, and France for the shea nut butter) to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted.

The group members intend to realize an average monthly profit of 49,160 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to buy wedding items for their daughters. Their goal is to have a house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with two sons – one is 20, the other one is only 3. Her family lives in Stryi. Galina sells food items in the local food market and offers commercial trade training to individuals and groups. Some of her customer services include: home delivery, wholesale discounts, and business training. Galina handles this enterprise with the help of her family: her husband and a brother who works in Lvov – a big city in Western Ukraine. They have been running this business for 19 years. Currently, Galina has 25,000 Grivnas in inventory. Her gross income amounts to 35,000 Grivnas. 

Galina is requesting a loan of 12,800 Grivnas to purchase different kinds of cereal and other grocery items for retail sale. She is hoping to open a wholesaling business in the future and believes this current step in consistent expansion lays a firm foundation for implementing her dream. Galina has a toddler to care for and has just moved to a new place with her family – but this busy life matches her natural enthusiasm and energy. Galina is planning to use a portion of the generated profit to pay her son’s college fees.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Marachi B Group

texts.en: Mrs. N. Salima, age 51, is widowed with 5 kids aged 20, 17, 15, 13, and 8 years and two dependents, all in school. She has been a tailor since 2007 located at the customs Busia border. She struggles to overcome her challenges. She is requesting this loan to purchase materials for clothing hoping to add more capital to her business for a change. Her community benefits from her skills. Her dream is to buy land, construct a house and make a good home.

loans.use: To purchase materials for clothing

loans.name: Robiyahon

texts.ru: Семья Робияхон состоит из мужа и 2 детей. Ей 37 лет, бизнесом стала заниматься несколько лет назад когда доход семьи стал падать. Работа  в колхозе уже не могла покрыть все расходы семьи, дети росли, и поэтому она решила найти другой источник дохода. Начала она торговать на рынке и тогда имела небольшой оборотный капитал. Постепенно вкладывая часть прибыли в оборотный капитал добилась большей прибыли. Также недавно ей стал помогать ее младший брат и теперь бизнес Робияхон содержит не только ее семью, но и семью брата. Робияхон дополнительно к своим деньгам решила получить небольшой займ и подала заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Robiyahon's family includes her husband and two children. She is 37 years old, and went into business several years ago when her family income started to drop, and work on the collective farm could no longer cover all the family expenses. The children were growing and so she decided to find another source of income. When Robiyahon started to trade at the market, she had very little working capital. The gradual reinvestment of a portion of her profits into the company yielded even bigger profits. Also, not long ago her younger brother began to help her, and now he and his family are part of the business as well. Robiyahon decided to take out a small loan to have extra money on hand, and applied to Kiva.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Joyce K. from Mbeya . She is married with four children between the ages of 2 and 10. Joyce has been running a genge business since 2008. A genge (grocery store) is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to, to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient. Joyce works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week and currently earns about $120 a month. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase items in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Joyce thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase items in bulk for her business

loans.name: Samfien

texts.en: A. is married to two wives and has six children. A. not only has a farm, but also raises pigs. With this loan, he plans to purchase two piglets, three bags of pig feed, fencing and labor to clear his farm. A. believes his business will succeed because he works hard and is honest with his customers. Having had failure with his business in the past, he knows what does not work. This is A.’s second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2007. With the profits from this loan he will pay for his children’s school fees and provide for his family needs. A. takes out GHAPE loans because the conditions of GHAPE membership require you to pay back the loan in regular, small installments, which works well for A.. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy two piglets, pig feed, fencing and to pay for farm labor

loans.name: Winefreda

texts.en:
Winefreda B., 55 years old, is married with 5 children and lives in Camanga Village, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur.

Winefreda has been engaged in her garden business for years, currently earning PHP 4,500 per month. She joined Paglaum MPC last year with a previous loan of PHP 3,000. She is now on her 3rd loan and has applied for PHP 5,000 which she will use as capital in her garden business to buy fertilizer. The profit she generates from her garden will be used as their livelihood.

loans.use: To use as capital for her garden busines and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mirzomurod

texts.ru: Каримов Мирзомурод проживает в районе Шахринав. Возраст 49 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Мирзомурод более 15 лет работал строителем. В данный момент, он более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Он имеет торговую точку, где торгует мясными изделиями. Клиент просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Mirzomurod K. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 49 years old, married and has 3 children. Mirzomurod used to work as a construction worker for over 15 years. Currently, he has been involved in sales for over 5 years. He has a store where he sells meat products. Client is requesting a loan to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Muth

texts.en: Muth V., 46, is married with three children living at home in the Takeo province. She is a fortuneteller, typically making US$3 each day and her husband sells natural medicines. Her husband, Nov Tith, typically makes about US$2 each day. Two of the children are students and one is a mechanic, repairing motorbikes to earn approximately US$3 every day to help support the family. Muth V. would like a loan of US$500 to purchase mechanic tools for her son to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase mechanic tools.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Doradinas en Acción”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 37 años y es madre de 03 hijos que aun dependen de ella.   

Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, juntamente con su esposo emprendieron su negocio de venta de carnes ahumadas como: chorizos, cecinas y chicharrones. Para el horneo de ellas, es su esposo quien los realiza y Margarita se encarga de prepararlos y ofrecer a sus clientes,  con  el carisma y la buena atención que le caracteriza. 

En la actualidad, continúan con el mismo negocio y ya lleva 04 años dedicándose a esta actividad y con este préstamo de S/. 600.00, comprará carnes en cantidad, para luego venderlos.

Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela, por apoyar a mujeres como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Sra. Margarita is a member of the Communal Bank “Doradinas en Acción”, which is located in the District of San José de Sisa, Dorado Province, Department of San Martín. She is 37 years old, married, and the mother of 3 dependent children.

Given the need to generate a household income, Margarita and her husband started their business selling smoked meats such as chorizo sausage, jerky, and fried pork skins. Her husband smokes the meats, while Margarita is in charge of preparing the products for sale and tending to customers. She is known for her charisma and attentiveness.

She has been in business for 4 years. With her loan of 600 soles, Margarita will purchase meat in bulk for future resale. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for supporting women like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes to continue her membership for a long time and help other women entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat in bulk

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora C. is from the village of Mialen,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old and single. To make a living, Leonora raises livestock, primarily pigs for sale. Leonora has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2009, Leonora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the business.

------------------ About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase livestock feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase commodities in bulk for her store

loans.name: Vasati

texts.en:
Vasati U. is a 41-year-old woman living in the town of Taufusi.  She is married and has four adult children.  To make a living, Vasati owns & operates a business selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Vasati has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately $1250 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Vasati joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Vasati has successfully repaid a previous loan of $1600 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Vasati is now requesting a new loan of $2200 WST, which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business.  The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Vasati from SPBD.  Vasati plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle

loans.name: Xuxa Jandire

texts.es: Xuxa es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región  de Ucayali, tiene 21 años, es soltera, estudia en la Universidad Nacional de Ucayali (Psicología) y se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza  para solventar sus gastos universitarios, cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres, pero ella se esfuerza por salir adelante y aumentar sus ventas. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Virtuosas” desde hace tres años. El primer crédito que obtuvo le permitió invertir en colonias, talcos, lápiz labial, en la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas, lápiz labial, etc. La meta de Xuxa es culminar sus estudios y  tener una tienda de prendas de vestir y accesorios.
texts.en:
Xuxa is an enterprising and dynamic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. Xuxa is 21 years old, single, and studies psychology at the National University of Ucayali. She sells beauty products in order to pay for her college expenses. Even though she has the support of her parents, she strives to get ahead and increase her sales.

Xuxa became a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Virtuosas” (Virtuous Women) three years ago. She used her first loan to buy colognes, talcum powders, and lipsticks. At the moment, she needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase beauty products such as perfumes, crèmes, lipsticks, and other items. Her goal is to finish her studies and open a store where she sells clothing and accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora es una mujer muy simpática de 50 años, vive con su esposo, Segundo, que tiene 52 años, y con su hija, también de nombre Nora, que es una joven de 21 años. Ellos viven felices en una acogedora casa de un distrito sobresaliente ubicado al sur de la ciudad de Lima.

Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de una conocida marca y con el pasar de los años ha crecido y se ha convertido en líder de su zona, esto significa que además de vender estos cosméticos capta nuevas vendedoras, y esto le favorece aún mas económicamente, porque recibe grandes incentivos por sus ventas.
A Nora le gusta su trabajo y ya se acostumbró a persuadir a sus clientes para que compren mayor cantidad de cosméticos, ella ha aprendido bastante de este rubro y sabe crear una necesidad en las personas. 
Cada mes recibe los frutos de su esfuerzo y para el futuro piensa seguir trabajando con esta marca de cosméticos que tantas satisfacciones le ha brindado, además de poner un bazar en su casa donde vendería esto productos de belleza y otros artículos  necesarios para el hogar.

Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y sabe que si es responsable en sus pagos podrá salir adelante con sus sueños. Además está muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su grupo porque está compuesto por mujeres emprendedoras. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará lo necesario para implementar su bazar y ya tiene pensado cómo colocar todo en la habitación que está junto a su sala, donde será su futuro negocio.
texts.en:
Nora is a very likable 50 year old woman. She lives with her 52 year old husband, Segundo, and her daughter. Her daughter is also named Nora, and she is 21. They live happily in a cozy house in an excellent district, which is located to the south of the city of Lima. She has been selling brand name cosmetics for 15 years. With the passage of time, her business has grown, and she has become a leader in her area. This means that in addition to selling cosmetics, she attracts new sellers. This helps her even more economically because she receives great incentives for her sales. Nora likes her work, and she has become used to persuading her customers to buy larger quantities of cosmetics. She has learned a lot in this field, and she knows how to create a cosmetic need for people. Every month she receives the fruit of her efforts. In the future she plans to keep working with this brand of cosmetics that has brought her so much satisfaction. She would also like to set up a bazaar in her house where she would sell her beauty products and other necessities for the home. This is the second time that she has had a loan with MFP. She knows that if she is responsible with her payments, she will be able to get ahead with her dreams. She is also very satisfied with the work her group does because it is comprised of hard-working women. She will use the money that she is now asking for to buy what is necessary to start a bazaar. She has already thought of how to place everything in the room, which is next to the living room. That is where her future business will be.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Set up her store

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro and his wife Merlinda reside in the village of Barangay Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. Their main source of income is a motorcycle transport business. Additionally, Pedro is also engaged in farming, while Merlinda sells fruits and vegetables in their village to earn extra income. 

In order to further develop his transportation business, Pedro is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 from the Kiva lenders. He hopes that his loan request will be approved so that he can maintain his motorcycle transport and have his business grow and earn more of a profit.

Pedro and Merlinda are blessed with ten children who range from 5 to 26 years old.

loans.use: maintaining his vehicle and expanding his business

loans.name: Wartohi

texts.en: Wartohi is a 42-year-old woman with 2 children. She has owned a snack shop since 2008 and has a previous 16 years of experience in this market. Today, Wartohi is asking for a loan of US$ 1,200 to enlarge her shop and add new decor in order to attract new customers and make a good income.

loans.use: enlarge her shop and add new decor

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lorena M. de 48 años, vive en uno de los pocos sectores que tiene la facilidad de contar con agua, luz y alcantarillado todavía el camino de su casa no esta pavimentado su ubicación es en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, Lorena empezó hace 4 años vendiendo Yanbal por medio de una amiga que la animo a vender cosméticos y así tener una entrada de dinero para su familia.
 
Lorena trabaja de las 14:00 hasta las 18h00 vendiendo cosméticos y perfumes, comprar mensualmente un total de $ 280.00 en cosméticos y los vende sacando $ 400.00 mensual, ayudándole también su hija de 16 años a vender cosméticos y perfumes.

El esposo de Lorena le ayuda con los gastos familiares vendiendo frutas ellos tienen 4 hijos, uno de 29 años otro de 24 años otro de 19 años y la menor de sus hijas tiene 16 años quien estudia en un colegio fiscal.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas cosméticos para poder agrandar su negocio en su casa, en el futuro Lorena quiere arreglar su domicilio y tener más variedad en su mercadería.
texts.en:
Lorena M., 48, lives in one of the few sectors of the outskirts of Guayaquil that has running water, electricity and drainage. The street where she lives isn't paved yet. Four years ago Lorena began selling Yanbal (a brand of catalogue cosmetics) thanks to a girlfriend who encouraged her to do so in order to have a source of income for her family. She works from 2pm until 6pm selling cosmetics and perfumes. She buys $280 worth of cosmetics per month and she sells them for $400 per month. Her 16-year-old daughter helps her sell. Lorena's husband helps out with household expenses; he's a fruit merchant. They have four children, a 29-year-old, a 24-year-old, a 19-year-old and their youngest daughter, 16, who is in public secondary school. She will use the financing to buy cosmetics so that she can enlarge her business in her home. In the future, Lorena would like to improve her home and have a larger variety of stock merchandise available.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cosmetics, perfumes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther owns a shop where she sells articles such as nails, toothbrushes, padlocks, keys and other items. She is 38 years old and married with 5 children.  Esther has been in this business for 7 years and business is now booming. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN. With this loan, she plans to increase and expand her stock. With this volume of business, Esther hopes to increase her earnings in the long run and be able to better provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is a 45-year-old single mother of four children, of whom the eldest is 20 years. All her children go to school and she doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in and rents a one-roomed house where she is staying with three people. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day.

Barbara has a stall selling bananas in Kalerwe market. She doesn’t incur transport costs to and from buying bananas as she buys from her place of work from delivery trucks which bring them from the villages. She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She works six days a week. She receives an average of 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people, retail and wholesale.

Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family and monthly market dues for her business and school fees for her children and rent. Her major business challenges are the rainy season which hinders her customers from reaching out to her because she works in muddy place.

Barbara has been in this business for seven years and with MCDT for thirteen years, servicing her twenty-sixth loan, working with the same group mates. Barbara joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas.She is aspiring of seeing her business grower bigger and of going to farmers directly.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru: Мамарахимова Сафаргул проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 39 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Сафаргул более 5 лет занимается земледелием. Она выращивает пшеницу. В этой деятельности ей помогает муж. Кредит просит для закупа семян и удобрений, чтобы посеить новый урожай.
texts.en:
Safargul M. lives in the Yavan region. She is 39 years old. She is married and has four children. Safaragul has been doing agriculture for more than five years. She grows wheat. Her husband is helping her in this business. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to sow new crops.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mainouna

texts.fr:
Madame  Mainouna T.  est âgée de 41 ans, mariée  et mère  de 2 enfants.  Elle  vit chez son mari  dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Somono de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Mainouna a abandonné l’école en classe de 3 ème  année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien)  pour faire le petit commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des friandises. Après plusieurs d’apprentissage auprès de cette dernière pour mieux maîtriser les rouages du commerce,  elle finit par évoluer seule en faisant  le commerce de mil et de riz,  depuis maintenant 7 ans. 
Elle jouit d’une grande clientèle et tient son commerce au marché Somono de la ville de Ségou.  
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 48 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel  qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 800 kg de riz. Elle s’approvisionne dans la zone office du Niger précisément à Dougabougou et Séribala.
Madame   Mainouna T.  vend  généralement au comptant à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permet d’aider son mari et de participer aux événements sociaux (baptême, mariage etc.…). 
Son ambition est d’avoir un terrain  à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mainouna T. is 41 years old, married and has two children. She lives with her husband in a nuclear family in the Somono district of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Mainouna left school in the third grade of elementary school (according to the Mali education system) in order to set up a small business at her mother's to sell sweetmeats. After several years' apprenticeship with her mother in order to master the mechanics of business, she ended up developing her own business selling millet and rice, which she has been carrying out now for seven years. She benefits from a large customer base and carries out her business on the market of Somono in the town of Ségou. With the aim of increasing her working capital in order to make more profit, she resorted to Soro Yiriwaso. She has been in relations with this company for the past 48 months. After four group loans and two individual loans which have all been paid without incident, she is now on her third individual loan which she plans to use to buy 800kg of rice. She gets her supplies in the Office zone of Nigeria, more precisely in Dougabougou and Séribala. Mrs. Mainouna T. generally sells for cash to a customer base made up of both women and men. With this loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA. This profit will allow her to help her husband and to contribute to social events (baptisms, marriages etc.). Her ambition is to have a piece of land to live on.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Wintson's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at a primary school in Waterloo, a small town where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. This will be the second loan this group of teachers is seeking for from Kiva lenders through SMT. Their previous SMT/Kiva loan has made a significant impact in the lives of these borrowers.

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Mrs. Winston A.  (third from right) is the head teacher at the school. She was born in Hastings, 20 miles from Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She is age 55, a widow with two children. Both of her children are in Senior Secondary School (SSS). She has been a teacher for 34 years now. Mrs. Winston will use her share of the loan to buy house-building materials – cement, sand, etc.-- to start constructing a house consisting of two bedrooms and a parlor.

loans.use: Buy house-building material – cement, sand, etc--to start constructing a house

loans.name: Lolita's Group

texts.en:
Lolita Q. is from the village of Cabisera 27, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Lolita is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lolita Q..

Lolita is widowed and has 5 school-aged children. Lolita owns & operates a livestock business, raising pigs for fattening and sale. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Lolita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lolita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 30 years old and married with two children who go to school. He runs a cafeteria in his hometown to earn a living. He has been in this business for three years and has two employees. He also keeps animals for commercial purposes to increase his income.

Jonathan hopes to grow his business and improve his living standards in the future. He has requested a loan of Kes 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy ingredients for cooking.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 43 year old married woman from Lebanon, who has three children. She repairs and does all type of clothes for men and women, also she does curtains, and bed sheets and more. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to open a sewing shop. 

Fatmeh has been working from her house as a seamstress, and lately she has realized that she needs more space knowing that she has a broad customer base that includes friends, neighbors, family members and people from her region. Also, the fact that she receives her clients at home has been inconvenient for her family. This is her second loan, and she has reimbursed her previous loan on time. Her first loan let her purchase thread for her business. 

Fatmeh is speciA. in her work because she is known for her good and precise work. When she first started her business, she couldn’t afford purchasing a sewing shop because she didn’t have enough income; however know she has increased her customer base and her income. She learned the business when she was young so she has always been sewing. She plans to keep on improving her work and to expand her business to the surrounding villages.

loans.use: To open a sewing shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stock for store

loans.name: Kouser Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Kouser perveen is very confident that an investment in her husband's business will help it greatly, because she knows that he is very hard working person but the problem he faces is the lack of capital to invest in his business. 

Kousar perveen has applied for a loan from Asasah which will help her husband improve his scrap business by adding more scrap. Kousar perveen lives in Multan and does embroidery work to support her family financially. 

She is very hopeful that she will be able to help her children complete their education by increasing her household income through investment in the business.

loans.use: Purchase scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es casada, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 6 viven con ella y estudian, Maria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, animales menores, que luego comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y también de casa en casa, en algunas oportunidades cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo.
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio y necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que sera invertido en la compra de gallina, chancho y cereales.
Maria sueña con construir mas ambientes en su casa  y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria is married and has seven children, six of whom live with her and are students. She travels around to different markets in the area to buy cereals and young animals which she then sells in the Ayacucho markets as well as door-to-door. Sometimes her husband helps her. Maria is a member of the Lirio Community Bank. She needs a loan of 2,000 soles to buy chickens, pork, and cereals. Her dreams are to build more rooms on to her house and to see her children get good jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chickens, pork and cereals

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.en:
Edmundo C. is from the town of Talibon. He is 48 years old. Edmundo is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Edmundo owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. He works hard to earn more and be able to support his children's education.

Edmundo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edmundo is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edmundo from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, CEVI has numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en: Siranush A. is 25 years old, and lives with her mother. To support herself and her mother from a young age, Siranush opened a clothing business which she has run since 2002. She rents a spot in a trading market place, from where she sells women’s clothing. Siranush regularly imports clothing to meet her clientele’s demand. It is more expedient for her to travel to the neighboring country to make the purchase personally. This loan will cover the purchase of clothing and customs fees.

loans.use: To cover the purchase of clothing and customs fees.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen L. D. Q. D. 41 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Alegría, ubicado en el departamento D. Usulután, vive junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como empleado para una empresa privada. La señora Maria del Carmen posee una tienda en la que comercializa diferentes tipos D. productos, ya sea para el cuidado y limpieza del hogar como también alimenticios, dicho negocio  esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual tenga la capacidad económica D. surtir su negocio, esto debido a que La señora María del Carmen no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo, y es muy necesario tanto para ella como para su esposo, ya que es este el negocio que les permite solventar todos sus gastos familiares. Ella desea poder surtir su tienda con productos como detergente, comida enlatada, pan, golosinas, bebidas y otros productos más, los cuales son D. primera necesidad en un hogar y que también son los que se solicitan más en una tienda.
texts.en:
María del Carmen L. D. Q., 41, lives in the town of Alegría, located in the department of Usulután. She lives with her husband, who works for a private company. Maria has a store in which she sells different types of products, both household products and foods. This business is located in her house. She is asking for a loan so she will have enough money to stock her store. María asks this because she does not have the necessary funds to do it, and it is very necessary both for her and for her husband because this business allows them to cover their household expenses. She wants to be able to stock her store with products like detergent, canned foods, bread, snacks, drinks and other products which are basic necessities in a home and which are also asked for most in a store.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic products to stock a store

loans.name: Enriquieta

texts.en:
Enriquieta C. is from Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Enriquieta is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Enriquieta owns & operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling of fruits in the local community. Enriquieta has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Enriquieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Enriquieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Enriquieta is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fruits to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Enriquieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits to sell.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
la sra. Teofila C. tiene 59 años de edad, vive en el Barrio el Puente Trojes El Paraiso, Teofila se dedica a la venta de granos de maiz, este tipo de negocio es muy bueno ya que muchas personas compran maiz para hacer tortillas, tamalitos y tambien lo compran para comida para animales.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de sacos de maiz ya que las exigencias de sus clientes han incrementado y a veces se queda sin maiz para la venta.
esta es la unica actividad que Teofila realiza para generar dinero para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Teofila C. is 59 and lives in the el Puente Trojes El Paraiso neighbourhood. Teofila sells corn.
